characters: IN THE SAME SQUALID APARTMENT BUILDING
THE HIGH-PITCHED WHISTLING SOUND IS HEARD AGAIN
A GRINDING OF TREADS ON ASPHALT
THE BATTLE OF BROOKLYN HAS BEGUN
THE SURVEILLANCE OF SHARON AND SAMIR
INSIDE THE THEATRE, (A VIDEO CLIP TURNS BACK TO FILM)
THE TWO OTHER YOUNG ARABS, HOWEVER --
THE DOOR TO THE CLEAN APARTMENT
HUB SLAMS THE CONTOUR INTO THE WALL
THE JOINT FBI/NYPD TERRORISM TASK FORCE
A HALF-OPENED DOOR OF AN APARTMENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A coast road. Date palms. Burnt-out hulks that once were  Russian T-54 TANKS have long ago been left to rust in the sun. A 4-door MERCEDES hurtles down the ancient road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're online for exactly two minutes.

dialogues.speaker: A SATELLITE VIEW
dialogues.text: Of the same scene. A grainy IMAGE of the car, and some  distance away, a moving cluster of animals. They are:

dialogues.speaker: HERD OF SHEEP
dialogues.text: As seen at ground level. Two SHEPHERDS goad them forward. the distance, the MERCEDES approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: U.S. Army medics and rescue workers frantically sift thro the rubble of a collapsed barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...the single worst casualty in the  history of American military --"

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: The Mercedes barrels down the road, doing at least 80 mph

dialogues.speaker: THE SATELLITE VIEW
dialogues.text: Shows that the car is fast approaching the point where th herd of sheep are about to cross the road.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Amidst the rubble, the dead are zipped into body bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-- the truck, carrying high  explosives is believed to have hit  the barracks --

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: The driver of the Mercedes hits his horn but doesn't slow down. In addition to the driver and a bodyguard, an OLD M WITH A HENNAED BEARD, a turban, and sunglasses sits in ba

dialogues.speaker: THE SATELLITE VIEW
dialogues.text: As the Mercedes closes with the sheep:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: As if on command, the Mercedes finally slows as the sheep move lazily across the road.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: President Clinton addresses reporters in the White House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To any lengths, anywhere in the  world, to bring these people to  justice."

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Inside the Mercedes, they watch as the Shepherd urinates the sheep mill about in the middle of the road. The drive rolls down his window to scream in Arabic at:

dialogues.speaker: THE POOR SHEPHERD
dialogues.text: Who hurries to button his fly. It is only as we look clos that we see the silenced muzzle of:

dialogues.speaker: COLT COMMANDO RIFLE
dialogues.text: Protruding from the sleeve of his jhallabah. And then:

dialogues.speaker: THE HERD OF SHEEP
dialogues.text: Fill the frame, blocking our view of the Mercedes, and fo moment, all we can HEAR is their gentle bleating. But as  they clear frame, we can see that:

dialogues.speaker: THE MERCEDES
dialogues.text: Has been turned into an abattoir, its windshield shattere and bloody. The driver slumps over the steering wheel, th bodyguard is half out of the window. And in the distance:

dialogues.speaker: WITH A MAGICIAN'S ALACRITY
dialogues.text: One Shepherd pulls a BLACK HOOD over the Sheik's head whi the other injects him with a HYPODERMIC. The first Shephe activates a SATCHEL CHARGE and swings it into the Mercede while the second straps the Sheik into a HARNESS... A BAL self-inflates and hurtles aloft, pulling a cable attached the Sheik's harness.

dialogues.speaker: AN MC-130 COMBAT TALON AIRCRAFT
dialogues.text: Its "Whiskers" in the nose of the aircraft snag the cable without slowing and roars off, the Sheik dangling unconsc beneath -- just as the satchel charges EXPLODE the Merced

dialogues.speaker: THE SATELLITE VIEW
dialogues.text: Records impassively for a moment, then breaks up into sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotcha.

dialogues.speaker: IN A SAFE HOUSE
dialogues.text: A pale, diminished Sheik sits at a steelcase table. A STE COT and a STEEL TOILET. Closed-circuit cameras in the cor Opposite him: the man, whose voice we have only heard: GE WILLIAM DEVEREAUX -- and though he wears a civilian suit, his bearing betrays his pedigree. His considerable charm habitual skepticism are as much a product of self-discipl as his close-order drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody knows you're here. Not your  people. Not even my President. You'll  die here alone and be buried unknown --  barring some miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHEIK speaks a few words in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- God? GOD? (looks at him) What you eat. Whether you eat. Sleep.  Pain. Absence of pain. I decide. I  make the day and the night. Even the  way you got here -- a hand that  reached down from the sky? (looks at him) God? I am your new God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MUEZZIN climbs a spiral staircase, enters a turret-like room, CLICKS ON a microphone and CHANTS the call to praye

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allahuh Akbar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HUNDREDS OF BELIEVERS prostrate themselves on prayer rugs At the door, hundreds of SHOES are lined up, work boots,  expensive loafers, a range of social classes represented.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Shopkeepers pause to kneel and pray. In Arab homes, paren and children do the same. And as we PULL BACK from:

dialogues.speaker: THE MINARET
dialogues.text: Of the Mosque, we DISCOVER not an Arab city, but instead unmistakable skyline of:

dialogues.speaker: DOWNTOWN MANHATTAN
dialogues.text: The World Trade Ctr, Wall Street, The Federal building.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FBI SITUATION ROOM
dialogues.text: Two AGENTS hurry through the bullpen. TINA OSU, 32, sharp and FRANK HADDAD, Lebanese with an insouciant grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brooklyn South issued a code blue  less than two minutes ago. They think  hostages are involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black-and-whites on the scene?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Setting up a perimeter now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Residence or business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE 99 BUS
dialogues.text: Surrounded by a phalanx of Black-and-Whites.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: They have been joined by Anthony Hubbard, the ASAC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negotiator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb squad?

dialogues.speaker: THE 99 BUS
dialogues.text: The BOMB SQUAD approaches. We SEE terrified PASSENGERS in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon can we get there --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this traffic, maybe tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: As a police TECHIE inserts a dentist's mirror through a  drilled hole in the bus's door, the L.E.D. begins to BLIN and the passengers SCREAM and dive for cover. An EXPLOSIO

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Frank is listening to a cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck. It just blew.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: The doors hang off their hinges. As the PASSENGERS tumble off, we SEE they are covered in BLUE PAINT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's what they're telling me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And nobody's hurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank nods. Hubs closes his eyes in gratitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: THE JOINT FBI/NYPD TERRORISM TASK FORCE
dialogues.text: They're listening to a tape-recording, altered by a VO-CO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- our first and last warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the MESSAGE continues, we PAN the faces: MIKE JOHANNSO squad supervisor, and DANNY SUSSMAN, representing NYPD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We expect our demand to be met. There  will be no negotiation. That is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Demand for what? You hear any demand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure this is all they got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's performance art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sussman shoots him a look. Clearly Haddad enjoys pushing buttons. Finally, Hub stands up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Okay. Blue paint. Voice-altering  technology --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- available from The Sharper Image  catalogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last I looked they weren't offering  exploding paint bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, the rhetoric sounds political.  Militia?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not their style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jihad isn't known for their sense of  humor, and Hamas is raising so much  money here, why queer their deal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, isn't Green the color of  Islam, not blue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And, excuse me, but why do we  immediately assume they're Arabs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a composite of the suspects  in circulation by the end of business  today. Tina, you cross-check it  against the mainframe. Mike, have  you got the lab analysis on the paint?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- See if any was sold in quantity  the last month. Danny --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina's phone buzzes. She picks it up as Hub keeps going:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- find out what stop these guys got  on the bus, maybe there's a witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub... I think we're all eager to  give up our weekends on this. It  just occurs to me, has anybody even  committed a crime here? I mean,  assault with a deadly color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub deals with Haddad's irreverence by ignoring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's what I don't like. They know  explosives. They know our response  time. They put in a call and walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young agent, FRED DARIUS, hands Hub a piece of paper:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir. I think you should  see this. Came in on the Fax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two words are written: "RELEASE HIM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release him? Him who? Who are we  holding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marv Albert?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: McVeigh? Sheik what's-his-name from  the Trade Center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Omar Abdel Rahman... asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hamas guy got released in April.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under protest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at the fax) Why be coy about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's phony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the phone) Hub, somebody's flashing a government  badge over at the warehouse where  they're working on the bus. Our tech  guys want to know if we're cooperating  with any other agencies on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Hub's look, we:

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD WAREHOUSE IN BROOKLYN
dialogues.text: Hub and Haddad join AGENT FLOYD ROSE, a tall Black man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- She's looking for wiring signatures  on the device and asking for copies  of any latent prints we've managed  to lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Agency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like it. Turns out she's also  been talking to some of the  passengers.

dialogues.speaker: THEY OPEN THE DOOR
dialogues.text: In the klieg lights -- THE BUS. Men in white coats dust e inch and generally behave as if investigating a crashed U In their midst, a young WOMAN, midwestern pretty in a ser suit. She looks up as Hub enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Agent Anthony Hubbard. FBI.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit, I've been trying to liaise  with you all day. My name is Elise  Kraft, National Security Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She offers her hand. Hub doesn't take it yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And you've been trying to "liaise"  with me all day? Did you think of  trying the phone book, Elise? We  have fourteen lines, that's not  counting the unlisted ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still holds out hand) Hi, I'm Elise Kraft, National Security  Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he takes her hand. And doesn't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm Colin Powell. What exactly  do you people want with my bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to take her hand away, but he tightens his grip

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all on the same team here,  Agent Hubbard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who exactly is "we" on this particular  team, Elise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never the question that's  indiscreet, only the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles. She smiles back. Convinced she's charmed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you what, you send me an official  inter-agency request for cooperation  on this and I'll give you copies of  everything we come up with. Otherwise,  get your ass on out of here before  you contaminate my crime scene any  more than you already have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no reason to be nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is nasty? (smiles) In case you haven't heard. The CIA  has no charter to operate  domestically. Which puts you in  violation of federal law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not according to the Cooperation  Agreement, Special Order 12333 -- I  suggest you reread the paragraph on  sharing information. I happen to be  well within my authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Special Order 12333 refers to domestic  terrorism. You got something you  want to "share" with me? (he waits... but no  answer is forthcoming) Us being teammates and all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up a clipboard) Unfortunately, not yet. But as soon  as I do, I'll --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- get back to me, yeah, I know. (takes the clipboard  from her hands) Here's what I'm gonna do. I'm gonna  have a couple my "teammates" here  escort you back to wherever you came  from. And then I'm gonna go back to  the office and wait for that official  cooperation request. Okay by you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, Elise. Is that  Elise with an "E" or an "A"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice meeting you, too, Special Agent  Hubbard.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Hub watches as Elise is led away by two AGENTS. Agent Ros stands nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tail her.

dialogues.speaker: NICE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: In Frank Haddad's home. The Haddad's are celebrating the FRANK JR. has finished reading the Holy Koran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) "In the Name of Allah, the beneficent,  the merciful. Say: I seek refuge in  the Lord of Men, the King of Men."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's TEACHER offers the final benediction. Those who a Muslim cover their face with their palms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) "Make me know that which I have become  ignorant of; and make me recite it  in the hours of the night and the  day; and make it an argument for me  O Thou Sustainer of all the worlds!"  Ameen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ameen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Later -- The guests mingle, eat pastries and drink sweet tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Nice, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) You ever gonna stop by, pick up your  things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Mike and Danny observe them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He doing her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some detective you are. They stopped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I wonder if she likes white  guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wonder if she likes bald guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, meanwhile, congratulates Frank's wife, NAJIBA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be so proud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small children, small worries. Big  children --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- big orthodontia bills. Someday,  you'll understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Frank notices Hub's DRIVER standing in the doorw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're staying with your family. I'm  back in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script. Sequence omitted from original script. (ALREADY SHOT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub is looking at surveillance photos of Elise. Frank ent

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleep here? (Hub smiles, but  doesn't look up) Immigration called.

dialogues.speaker: A SMALL GREEN ROOM
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank watch a dark-skinned MAN being questioned b uniformed OFFICIAL. An INS Supervisor shows them a false- bottomed suitcase stuffed with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- all in small bills. So we figure,  smurf, right? Then I think,  considering the gentleman's  nationality, plus where he's been  recently, we better call Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- who's trying to score points with  his boss, bigtime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he broken any laws?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. He's twenty bucks under the  $10,000 limit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulls out a $20 bill) Not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROOM
dialogues.text: The official hopes volume breaks the language barrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so, Kahlil, you're saying this is  an INHERITANCE? Somebody DIED and  you're bringing them the MONEY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dark-skinned man is trying to keep up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no... dhouri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...He means, "dowry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check out his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Small puckered SCARS. The INS guy looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tabac. (mimics putting out a  cigarette on his arm) Sssssss... The territories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks a moment) Put him in play.

dialogues.speaker: THE VAN WYCK EXPRESSWAY
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank in a rental CONTOUR, tail Khalil, in a cab:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) -- on the Van Wyck... No, not yet. (to Frank) -- What are we in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A '97 Contour. On my Visa. (watches Khalil) Back home, the security services'd  be up this guy's ass with a poker,  but what do we do, we let him go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still on the phone) ...Six teams on the ground, at  least... well, pull 'em off the UN... (to Haddad) Stay back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my first date, Hub. (the TAXI changes  lanes) He's taking the BQE. Looks like it's  Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still on the phone) I want husbands and wives, I want  baby carriages, and no Brooks  Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're micro-managing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still on the phone) -- And find me a judge I can work  with. We want sound on this guy...  damn'... I'm losing you... (raises his voice) And bring us a radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get reimbursed for this, right?

dialogues.speaker: ATLANTIC AVENUE
dialogues.text: The Third World. Teeming, roiling, Kinshasha meets Beirut meets Tel Aviv meets Moscow. Hand-written shop signs in A and Hebrew, boom boxes throbbing out "Oum Khatoum," the l neo-Palestinian techno-rock. KHALIL pays the taxi driver and starts off on foot. Hub's CONTOUR pulls over a safe distance behind and waits. An A passes by and slips a WALKIE-TALKIE through the open wind

dialogues.speaker: MAN CARRYING GROCERIES
dialogues.text: Falls in behind Khalil, who ducks into a storefront, wher WE CAN SEE him buying a Coca Cola and a Baby Ruth bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (notes the purchase) Twelve bucks in Gaza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America's the place to be if you're  a terrorist. (on the walkie-talkie) Fred's hovering. Patsy, take over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WOMAN WITH A STROLLER replaces the man carrying groceri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tell her to watch out for  reflections.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him the phone) I got the Judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) ...Good morning, Sir. How're things  in the Second Circuit this morning...?  ...I hear you... Listen, Judge, we're  in a kind of situation here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHALIL is on the move again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hold on, will ya, Judge? (into walkie-talkie) Is he talking to somebody, who's he  talking to? Are we getting film?

dialogues.speaker: FROM A GREAT DISTANCE
dialogues.text: An AGENT with a TELEPHOTO snaps a picture of Khalil, who paused to chat with a PALESTINIAN of patrician good-looks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the phone) -- Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't know him. If we were allowed  to get sound on them, we'd know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The walkie-talkie CRACKLES TO LIFE, confirming the photos

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covering the radio) ...What's that? No, Judge, not yet  we're not... but we have reason to  believe he may be involved with -- (covers the phone  again; keys the radio) Damnit Tommy! (to Frank) He's overacting! Tell him -- (back to the phone) Sorry, Judge... No... I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's making him. Shit. Fuck. He's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil has a sixth sense from a lifetime on the West Bank All of a sudden, he BREAKS INTO A RUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys radio) Go, go, go!!! All units --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slams the car into gear and PEELS OUT into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: SIX SURVEILLANCE TEAMS
dialogues.text: In various guises, break cover and SPRINT after Khalil, w shifts into overdrive. Cars SCREECH to avoid flattening h Hub's CONTOUR pulls into traffic and finds his way blocke by a narrow passage between double-parked cars. He goes f it, SCRAPING his way between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Judge, I'm gonna have to call you  back...

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL SPRINTS
dialogues.text: Into an open-air MARKET, KNOCKING DOWN veiled WOMEN with  bags of fruit and vegetables. He VAULTS over stalls. The CONTOUR scrapes PARKED CARS as it swerves into an all desperately trying to cut off Khalil's escape route.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit --! I didn't take the insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SOCCER BALL bounces into Hub's peripheral vision, follo by TWO BOYS.

dialogues.speaker: HUB SLAMS THE CONTOUR INTO THE WALL
dialogues.text: To avoid killing the two boys. Hub gets out of the car an continues the pursuit on foot. He's gaining on Khalil, wh

dialogues.speaker: A VAN
dialogues.text: Bears down on Khalil, its doors sliding open as TWO PAIRS HANDS reach out and ANOTHER MAN appears out of nowhere an BODYCHECKS Khalil into the van and jumps in after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van BURNS RUBBER and DISAPPEARS into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER --
dialogues.text: An impromptu huddle in the alley. AGENTS gather in a circ as RADIOS SQUELCH and HELICOPTERS circle above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just found the van. Doesn't  look like they're gonna find any  prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Agent who took the pictures pulls a color xerox-type  PHOTO from a digital printer in his car. Hub looks at the picture of Khalil and the good-looking Palestinian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run him down, bring him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred hands a cell phone to Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Floyd Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go, Floyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he listens, the first trace of a smile graces Hub's fa

dialogues.speaker: AN ORDINARY HOUSE
dialogues.text: In an ordinary neighborhood. Hub sits in an UNMARKED CAR. Agent Rose climbs into the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got two in the Plymouth, at  least three inside, and see that guy  walking his dog...? He did his  business about an hour ago and they're  still walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a dog like that once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not his dog, numbnuts. They're  spies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog works for the CIA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their radio CRACKLES to life. It's Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the radio) All units report in turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR "Unit 1 is good to go," "Unit 2, we're ready to r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's roll.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAN WALKING THE DOG
dialogues.text: Is suddenly double-teamed by TWO AGENTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal Agents. Hands behind your  back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A third AGENT throws his jacket over the dog.

dialogues.speaker: TWO UNMARKED CARS
dialogues.text: Fishtail across the quiet street, boxing in the Plymouth an AGENT from the sidewalk thrusts a 12-gauge Remington P in through the driver's window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Keep 'em where we can see 'em,  thank you very much.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Is BLOWN-IN by a specially-designed SHOTGUN. Two MEN, eat take-out are surprised by Frank and Tina, their guns draw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, guys, I expect you know the drill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub continues warily from one empty room to the next. A  stairway leads downstairs. As Hub starts cautiously down, muted VOICES can be heard. Reaching the bottom, he sees:

dialogues.speaker: KHALIL
dialogues.text: Sitting in a chair. Behind him stands one of FREELANCERS  from the warehouse. And opposite him, in a barca-lounger: ELISE KRAFT -- Somehow amidst the normalcy of the furnish basement is a palpable feeling of menace. As Hub shows himself, one of the Freelancers points a Glo .9 at his head. Hub just stares him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph, spare us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The freelancer lowers the gun. Hub looks at Khalil, whose face is badly bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never touched him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I'm taking him into custody  just the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to charge him  with? Jaywalking? (Hub stares at her) I don't suppose we could just have a  little chat with him here first?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not in this lifetime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Hub... may I call you Hub?  If you guys hadn't blown the  surveillance, we'd have been able to  follow the money. What do you think,  Khalil, you would have led us right  to your friends, wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil averts his eyes from any contact with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What friends --? What have you got  for me, Elise?... Enlighten me. (she stonewalls) Tell me now or tell me downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing. Hub calls out to his agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this guy out of here and book  him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the other agents approach Khalil:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One phone call and he's mine again.  You know the number. I have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have "the right to remain silent,"  you have "the right to an attorney.  Anything you say can and will be  held against you in a court of law -- "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping him) Oh, come on... Do you have any idea  what you're starting here, the kind  of shitstorm you're about to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overiding her) -- Kidnapping. Obstruction of Justice.  Assault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he heads out of the room, he says to a waiting Agent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuff her.

dialogues.speaker: HUB'S UNMARKED CAR
dialogues.text: Elise sits, handcuffed, alone in the back seat. Up front, Frank is driving with Hub beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Elise... You okay back there,  you don't get carsick or anything?  Those handcuffs too tight --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shouf mountains, right? Shiite or  Sunni?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You're really good. (to Hub) She's really good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to tell us what's going on  here, Elise --? Was the paintbomb a  warning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Haddad) American University of Beirut? I was  there from '79 to 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a look to Hub) No shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father taught Economics. Henry  Kraft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a terrorist cell operating  in this city that we are unaware of?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him; to  Haddad) Such a tragedy. Growing up in that  city was... paradise. Like an exotic  Paris, wasn't it, Frank --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been in Rikers, Elise? You  know what happens in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise looks at him, utterly unfazed by the threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's BEEPER goes off. As they look at one another, we:

dialogues.speaker: ABOUT A MILLION COP CARS
dialogues.text: Red lights flashing, have sealed off a Brooklyn Street. O the rooftops SWAT teams are already deploying. SHARPSHOOTERS politely insinuate themselves into the  surrounding family APARTMENTS and take up firing POSITION

dialogues.speaker: THE 87 BUS
dialogues.text: Stands alone in the middle of the street. Through a Marks SCOPE we SEE the terrified passengers forced to stand, ca glimpses of the TERRORISTS, obscured by the hostages. Hub confers with the NYPD officer-in-charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- definitely Arab-types, only this  time they're still in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any communication at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. It's weird they're just in  there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the frequency of the driver's  radio and patch it through to this  number. We need two lines. Frank,  get a negotiator out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, they've got kids in there. We  count six.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This rocks Hub for a moment but he covers it well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That gives us something to work with.

dialogues.speaker: BACK AT THE CAR
dialogues.text: Elise leans forward as Hub opens the driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening out there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub takes off his jacket, folds it carefully on the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've taken another bus, haven't  they? Talk to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, now you want to talk. You want  to be my friend, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, these guys are the real deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a terrorist cell operating  in Brooklyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long moment) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was the blue paint a warning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And I'm afraid this time they'll  blow the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they wanted to blow the bus then  why haven't they blown the bus --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Hubbard. Please. Maybe I can  help.

dialogues.speaker: A COMMAND POST
dialogues.text: Has been hastily improvised behind a SWAT van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver's name is Larry Kaiser.  He says they've got explosives  strapped to their chests, they got  automatic weapons, and they're  speaking Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell's the negotiator?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tunnel's got twenty minute delays  and they're working on both bridges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cop) What else did he say about the device?  Did he describe it at all? Anything  about a button, or a cord, or...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST ENG TRUCK
dialogues.text: Pulls up and raises its satellite dish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost involuntary) Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank turns to look at her. She is suddenly pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as it dawns on her) ...They're not here to negotiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were waiting for the cameras.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub is deep in conversation with the cops. Frank interrup

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks up. Frank nods for Elise to repeat what she sai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're want the newsies here. They  want everybody watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank look at each other. Can this be true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got the shooters in place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill 'em now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They just look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lose-lose any way you play it...  Do you want to lose little or lose  big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NYPD officer has been listening:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the marksmen on the com --  They're looking for a clean shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Policeman waits for a response on his radio, two m NEWS VANS pull up. The MEDIA CIRCUS has come to town:  reporters breathlessly offer their live, on-the-scene rep Hub and Elise stare at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shooter says they've got the  passengers all standing in the aisles.  He says, no go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub can see the dread in Elise's eyes. As the seconds tic away, TWO NEWS HELICOPTER jockey for position above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the cops) We have rules of engagement we're  gonna follow here, folks, so put the  safeties back on your weapons. (looks at Elise) Nobody's killing anybody until we  see what's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Larry, this is Agent Hubbard of the  FBI, I'll be negotiating our way out  of this. Let me talk to one of them...  I know... I know. You just hang in  there, Larry... No, don't worry,  I've got somebody here who can  translate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Frank, who's listening on another cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Sir, -- My name is Anthony Hubbard.  I don't have any authority to make  deals, or respond to demands. I just  want to find out if you need anything  in there? If any of the passengers  are in need of medical attention?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He waits as Frank translates. Hub covers the mouthpiece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if they understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Sir, is there anything you want to  say to me? That I can tell my people  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy's just breathing into the  phone, maybe they're not even Arabs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I get the feeling you don't want to  talk, but will you listen --?  ...Whatever grievance you have,  whatever quarrel -- surely it doesn't  involve these children --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still no response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) So I'm gonna ask you to... please...  let... the... children go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No response -- then suddenly, the bus doors HISS OPEN And six bewildered, ashen-faced CHILDREN step out before doors HISS closed behind them. As Hub and a couple of the cops hurry out from behind the barricades to help the chi cross the NO-MAN'S LAND to safety, a smattering of APPLAU breaks out among the cops. Elise tries to hold back tears

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, here we go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Thank you, sir. I appreciate that  gesture, I really do. The best way  to get what you want in these  situations is to show yourself to be  reasonable. As you've just done. (Haddad translates) Now we've got some more to talk  about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise watches as the news cameras zoom in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I am unarmed, as you can see. So I  propose... You let the rest of the  passengers go, and I take their  place... That way, there's no pizza  deliveries or bathroom breaks to  worry about -- and all these -- (indicates SWAT teams) -- people... will disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank shakes his head, don't do this. Hub's look says  translate it. Frank does it. They all wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I'm gonna take your silence to mean  you're considering my offer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise looks at Frank, she can't help but admire his brave

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about we just start with a few  of the elderly people you got on  there. It's got to be hard for the  older folks to be standing all this  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks back at Frank. Still no response. AND THEN THE BUS DOORS HISS OPEN AGAIN. A few elderly  PASSENGERS start down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Thank you, sir. Now let's just let  these --

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPLOSION OF THE BUS
dialogues.text: Hurls Hub backwards as:

dialogues.speaker: ALL SOUND FADES OUT
dialogues.text: To be replaced by a high-end, almost electronic WHITE NOI

dialogues.speaker: SHRAPNEL
dialogues.text: Imbeds itself into car doors, bus benches, doorways as ev WINDOW in a three-block radius is SHATTERED...

dialogues.speaker: RED BLOOD
dialogues.text: Replaces blue paint in a horrific shower.

dialogues.speaker: HUB
dialogues.text: Fights for consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: AGENTS
dialogues.text: Rush to his side to see if he is alright -- but WE CANNOT HEAR them. Though their mouths move it is only the WHITE  NOISE that overwhelms us -- as we realize that Hub has be momentarily DEAFENED by the blast. When at last Hub manages to speak, his words are MUFFLED INDISTINCT -- as if the playback heads of a tape recorder needed to be cleaned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... alright. I'm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Haddad bends down close and we can lip-read him say "Just hang in there, buddy. . ."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- okay... Just let me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then he leans over to VOMIT in the street.

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND OF SIRENS
dialogues.text: Slowly bleeds in through the white noise -- mercifully fo us, and for Hub, who wipes his mouth and looks up, realiz that his HEARING is coming back. He reaches for Frank's  outstretched hand and stands, albeit woozily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anybody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the look in Frank's eyes says it all.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEVASTATION
dialogues.text: Is numbing. IMAGES we associate with other countries. And then he sees Elise. Her face is cut and bleeding, but as  their eyes meet, her look is one of absolute compassion.

dialogues.speaker: MORE THAN A HUNDRED AGENTS
dialogues.text: Crowded into the now-overflowing BULLPEN. In absolute den of his physical condition, Hub paces like a caged animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- every trap, every hole. I want to  rumble every mosque, every community  center, every student organization  that's ever said an unkind word. I  want the heat turned up under all  our assets, all our informers, every  snitch gets twisted inside out. And  put some money out on the street --  Arab community hates these people as  much as we do. They'll help. (turns to Mike) Have you got positive ID on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, we don't have positive ID on  anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need more hands. Fred --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He picks up a phone and begins requesting Agent transfers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk to Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now she picks up a phone and adds to the cacophony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Conferences with DC at 9:00, 12:00,  4:00 and 9:00. Call your families,  find a sleeping bag, nobody leaves  this office until we have a strand  to pull. Oklahoma City, people. The  first twenty-four hours are the only  twenty-four hours.. And I don't want  to see anybody walking.

dialogues.speaker: TEN MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank watch Khalil through a VIDEO MONITOR. The  bruises on Khalil's face have deepened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor seen him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on his way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a cigarette --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub pockets the pack of cigarettes and walks into:

dialogues.speaker: THE CELL
dialogues.text: Frank hangs back in the doorway. Hub pulls up a chair, tu it backwards, and sits down very close to Khalil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank translates. Khalil pretends not to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khalil. I want to talk about the  money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again Frank translates. And again, Khalil looks blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub reaches into his pocket and casually takes out the pa of cigarettes. Khalil's eyes widen. Hub smiles at him. At the SOUND of the match lighting, SWEAT begins to bead on  Khalil's forehead. Hub takes his time LIGHTING the cigare drawing deep so the tip turns bright red. Khalil unconsci RECOILS in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank, re: Khalil) Doesn't like second hand smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub turns back to Khalil, casually gesturing with his  cigarette. Khalil almost jumps out of his skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ready to talk about money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank hasn't even begun to translate before Khalil begins SPEED-RAPPING in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) ...He says he loves America and only  wanted to get away from the security  services at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears stream down Khalil's face. He kneels at Hub's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still translating) ...He says he's sorry but he didn't  know he was doing something bad. His  cousin introduced him to a man who  promised him two hundred dollars for  his dowry if he'd bring the suitcase  to an address in Brooklyn. (to Hub) He's a cut-out.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Hub hands Tina back the pack of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nasty habit. (to Danny) 3830 Flatbush Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Bursts into an empty apartment. On the floor, a fax machi continuously sending the message: "RELEASE HIM."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want every rental agreement from  every landlord in Brooklyn. Hotels,  motels, flophouses... (to the other agents) It's cash, guys. They're the only  ones in America using cash.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: The room is dark. A TECHNICIAN operates an overhead PROJE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a spectograph of the semtex  used in the bomb. Look at the benzene  spike. This is the genuine article. (another slide) Now... this one's from the barracks  in Dhahran. As you can see, the  signature is identical.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: A COMPUTER TECHIE (WHITNEY) is cross-referencing data. DI PICTURES of suspected terrorists scroll past. A surveilla PHOTO of Ahmed bin Talal. The ruined army barracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ask it if they've ever hit buses?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The techie types in a few commands: IMAGES of destroyed B file past. Tel Aviv. Jerusalem. Beirut. None a match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not according to the mainframe.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: The BOMB SCENE now resembles an archeological dig. Floodl on stanchions. Forensic EXPERTS, on their hands and knees use BLACK LIGHT and brushes to search for latent prints.  Different color STRING divides the site into a grid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- with a Q-tip. Bone shards, hair,  fingernails --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, Danny and Mike observe Hub's intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- He's way over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up and go give somebody  a parking ticket.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: In THE LAB. A FINGERPRINT EXPERT sifts through a plastic of fingertips and teeth. Scans each into a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: Hub is STARING AT THE TV SETS which are all REPLAYING the terrible incident, over and over again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-- Today; Tel Aviv has come to  Brooklyn. The question... is why."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, he turns away so no one will see. His eyes are h with the emotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fingerprint techie races in, sparing Hub a response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got one!

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: Hub and Tina address twenty agents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, meet the late  Ali Waziri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He projects a PHOTO of the dead Terrorist onto the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina talked to the Israelis and traced  this sucker to a group operating out  of Ramallah. That's the West Bank,  not the West Side for those of you  just joining us from Nebraska.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few appreciative CHUCKLES. They're all exhausted. This the first good news in a bitch of a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, we've pulled his landing card  and his I-94. So now we know he came  in three days ago, out of Frankfurt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to where: A TIME-LINE has been created out of  colored strips beneath a bank of silent TV monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we need now is to fill in the  time between his arrival and the  incident. All known associations,  and most of all, we need an address.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HOURS LATER --
dialogues.text: The TIME-LINE is progressing. PHONE TECHNICIANS add tie-l dedicated fax lines, wats lines and scrambled lines. Cabl everywhere. Danny and Frank pore over Ali Waziri's I-94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IAP66. What's IAP66?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on, hold on, I'm looking it up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Today, Danny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait -- Here we go. Student  Visa, J-1.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub has been pacing, nearby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the original --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is... vaporized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the point of issuance. Could be  the American Consulate in Tel Aviv.  The American Consulate in Amman,  Cairo, Alexandria, Riyadh -- all an  easy drive from the West Bank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub suddenly had to fight off a wave of nausea and dizzin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three-fifteen. P.M. (off Hub's blank look) When's the last time you ate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred Darius, the young agent, appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir. They want you in the lab.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH A POWERFUL ELECTRON MICROSCOPE
dialogues.text: Hub peers through the eyepiece at a MAGNIFIED STRAND of f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure, unadulterated, Egyptian cotton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're saying they're Egyptian?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No... I'm just saying -- See...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's what they use for funerals.  The guy was wearing a shroud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Frank. It's just as Elise said. The real deal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see if she's ready to talk.

dialogues.speaker: A HOLDING CELL
dialogues.text: Elise sits quietly with the stillness of those who have b there before. Hub enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought one phone call and you  were out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't make the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just looks at him, entirely neutral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just some tinnitus in my left ear --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look across the professional chasm that divides them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to know what I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's too short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's a hint of some thawing in her tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We ordering in --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: IN A DOWNTOWN DELI
dialogues.text: Hub and Elise sit, eating corned beef sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The funeral shroud is the final  step in the ritual of self- purification. First a fast, then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the washing of the body, then the  shroud. I saw it on Sixty Minutes.  Tell me something I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pauses, always gauging how much to reveal. And when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Last March in Iraq, we identified  the man we believe responsible for  bombing the army barracks last year.  In August, he went to Lebanon. Where  he was... extracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extracted? Extracted by whom? (she just looks at  him) I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Sheik Ahmed bin Talal.  He's Iraqi. And something of a  religious leader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With something of a devoted following? (she nods) ...Okay, I can understand why we  might not want to publicize the fact  that our government's in the  kidnapping business, but why not  tell us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still being... debriefed. They're  not ready to go public with charges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else you got on his followers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clearly, they're committed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this game, the most committed  wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So they'll just keep coming until we  release him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we match their commitment  with our own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about talking to this sheik?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think they've got guys  talking to the sheik? Except the  sheik isn't talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who's giving the orders? How do  they coordinate, pick their targets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, we've put every resource  we've got onto that very question. (puts down her fork) Otherwise... we wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him. For one brief moment the mask drops awa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there's anybody on earth who knows  how you feel, it's me. But you've  got to let it go. Those people were  dead the minute they got on the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank Haddad appears, making his way toward their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, boss. Hello, Elise. Mmmm, is  that pastrami? (tastes it; then with  his mouth full) Oh, yeah, we made the guy in the  picture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: A CAFE
dialogues.text: Where Students sit inside and SMOKE, then SMOKE some more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My people. The last of the  unambivalent smokers. (shakes his head) Monsters. The toughest motherfucker  in Bed-Stuy is a muffin compared to  some of these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch as SAMIR gets his bill from the waiter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name's Samir Nazhde. Teaches  Arab Studies at Brooklyn College. He  sponsored Ail Waziri's student visa.  And dig this -- his brother blew up  a movie theatre in Tel Aviv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might consider leaving him alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would I consider doing that --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the cafe, Samir counts cash to leave on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play him like a cop and haul him in  now and get your arrest, or tag him  and let him lead you to the really  big fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an arabic curse) You're fishing and he's getting visas  for bombers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever heard of catch and release?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, and he's on the next plane for  Tunis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks at Elise. Samir is leaving -- it's now or never

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keys his radio) Go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THREE AGENTS brace Samir politely but firmly, and lead hi to their car. Samir slides into the back seat next to Eli In the REARVIEW MIRROR, Hub watches as a look seems to pa between them. Then again, it may not have happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir Nazhde, my name is Frank Haddad,  I'm a Federal Agent. We have reason  to believe you are an accessory to  the bombing of Bus 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an associate of Ali Waziri.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? I know no one by that name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise is looking out the window, seemingly oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got him a student visa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sign these applications as a matter  of course, hundreds of them. Everyone  wants to come to the land of  opportunity and Baywatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise tries to keep a smile off her face. Hub clocks this

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spent two years in Israeli jails  during the Intifada.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only ones who didn't were women  like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank BACKHANDS him across the mouth. Samir says somethin in Arabic to Frank, who responds in kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Family matter. (to Samir) You're going downtown, my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cannot hold me. I know my rights.  I watch American television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Defrauding the INS is a Federal  Offense. (hands Samir to waiting  agents) Reservation for one, please.

dialogues.speaker: CTF HEADQUARTERS
dialogues.text: They enter the BULLPEN. It's well past midnight. People a sacked-out in sleeping bags while others continue working

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Club Fed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank leans over Danny Sussman, who has fallen asleep, fa down on his desk, and sings in a lovely brogue:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) "Oh, Danny-boy, the perps, the perps,  are call-ing... (as he awakens) We need a search warrant on Samir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, c'mere a sec. I want to show  you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads Frank into another CUBICLE. Perched on nearby de Elise is dialing a phone, she stops to watch them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Frank, you ever hit a prisoner again  I'll have your badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Someday I will tell you what those  people did to my village in '71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub waits for him to calm down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touches his arm) Okay. But right now, act as if I'm  capable of saying something funny...  Now, let's go see about that warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk back, Hub says to Danny:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find me a Judge who'll play ball  this time. And set up a polygraph  for Samir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't understand why we're  tipping our hand with him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's there to tip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just trying to protect your  asset. (to Elise, pointedly:) Aren't you, Elise --? He's your Joe,  your asset. He's working for you,  you're his case officer -- right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should she respond? How thin should she slice it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Sometimes... in addition to being  a nationality, being a Palestinian  is also a... profession. A lucrative  one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning, he's your Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine. Yours. The Israelis. The Saudis.  At one time or another, everybody in  the Middle East has slept with  everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're saying... you sleep around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only professionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we share him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank) -- Call INS, find out his status and  start deportation proceedings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you can't let me do that. What  precisely is your involvement with  these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs, then:) Samir's been a very important...  project of mine for some time... I'm  the only one he'll deal with. He's  very well-connected -- and extremely  high-strung.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Call the judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Frank) How easy is it to get inside, Frank?  How good are your sources in the  mosques? How many people you got in  Hamas --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Franks shakes his head, ruefully. She's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No surveillance. I've seen your deft  touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daily reports. We tap his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I get to see the transcripts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I run him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We share him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't know we're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then don't tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank) Let him fly. (back to her) But we better start seeing product.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. A deal. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any more surprises for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm going home to get some  things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have somebody drive you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll grab a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone. Frank turns to Elise:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise. I'm really high strung, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She just smiles and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE FEDERAL BUILDING
dialogues.text: Not many people around. Hub stands on the corner. A TAXI  cruises up. On duty. Available. He slows long enough to s that Hub is black and passes right by.

dialogues.speaker: AT A RED LIGHT
dialogues.text: The taxi driver stops just long enough for Hub to slam hi SHIELD on the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TAXI
dialogues.text: Hub sits in back, hurtling into the night. The driver's I identifies him as ABDUL HASSAM. Hub shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHOWER
dialogues.text: As the hot SPRAY hits him, he runs his hands through his  hair and feels the BITS OF SHATTERED GLASS. Dried blood r off in rivulets from his hands. Not his own. He leans aga the shower wall, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: ELISE
dialogues.text: We are in her apartment. Samir looms over her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let him HIT ME --!! You cannot  care about me and let such things  happen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next time don't be such a smart ass --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I hate you just because  you are so American. It makes me  want to hurt you. I think about  fucking you and hurting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise can taste the blood in her mouth -- but it's the pr she's come to accept. In a heartbeat, it's all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You want to fuck me? Then work  with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me what I have to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Do we really want to have this  conversation again? Do we --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something quietly ominous in her tone. He lowers his eyes And like a sailboat, Elise changes tack. Strokes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to help me. I need you to  be strong. As you have always been  strong. For both of us. -- Samir?  Look at me...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HUB
dialogues.text: He's fallen asleep in a chair. In his lap is a pile of vi applications. His BEEPER goes off. He rouses himself.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO ELISE
dialogues.text: Sex without any shred of tenderness. As Samir kisses the  back of her neck, we SEE in her eyes the thousand-yard st

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO HUB
dialogues.text: In the doorway of an apartment building, Frank hands Hub styrofoam cup of coffee. It's a ritual between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Some people just cannot live in  the camps. For my brother, it was  already like dying. The only thing  he lives for is movies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits up in bed, reaching for another cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And then some sheik tells him  that, to die for Allah is beautiful.  If he does this thing, our parents  will be taken care of, and he will  live on in Paradise with seventy  virgins. Seventy. (sighs) And my brother, he needs to believe  it very much, so he straps ten sticks  of dynamite to his chest and goes to  the movies... (a rueful laugh) And I become a VIP. It is very  confusing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- So who are you afraid of betraying?  You know these people. They bomb,  they maim. Do they represent the  Palestine you want to build? (looks at him) They're using you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are using me, too! Everybody  uses the Palestinians! We are the  whores of the Middle East! (looks at her) You make reports about our little  talks --? What about fucking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to get special permission for  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he stands up, naked, and goes to the window, we SEE:

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME IMAGE
dialogues.text: Seen again, FROM MUCH FARTHER AWAY by Hub who stands on a ROOFTOP across the way, watching through 10Г—50 BINOCULAR Frank stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats cable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script. Sequence omitted from original script. Sequence omitted from original script. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE FEDERAL BUILDING
dialogues.text: Hub heads for his office, his SECRETARY nods inside. Some is waiting. It's Devereaux, in a civilian suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I understand they call you Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who you are, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering his hand) Bill Devereaux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I served in the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82nd Airborne, I know. Same time I  was running the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- 173rd. Put me through school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Duty. Honor. Country. Where on  Capitol Hill, Wall Street, or  Hollywood would you find one man  who's even paused over one of those  words in the last ten years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub is unsure why he's audience to such a command perform

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, uh, brings you here, General?...  Can I get you some coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to get to the point. The  President's concerned. He's worried  that -- have you met him by any  chance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir, I haven't. I know -- reading  the papers -- terrorism's a real  concern for him. And your job is to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- With all the affection for the  man I can tell you he doesn't know  fuckall about terrorism, or the  Mideast, that I don't put on his cue  cards. What he's expert in is his  own survival. You get my meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't guess you came all this way  for a cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Hubbard -- you look like you  think I'm here to take your baby  away!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all respect for your expertise,  sir. We're on track here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is what I said to the President --  the Army is not some big green police  department. Stick with the man on  the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate your support.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're sure you're not chasing your  own tail, though?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub considers for a moment, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about Sheik Ahmed  Bin Talal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not. We've received two  communications -- from the bombers  to "Release Him."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't release him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know our stated policy is not to  negotiate with terrorists, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, we can't release him because we  don't have him. We never had him.  And besides that, he's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CIA? The CIA couldn't predict  the fall of the Berlin Wall until  bricks were hitting them in the head. (resuming) The Libyans snatched the Sheik --  some sectarian Muslim thing -- I'll  explain it next time you have a free  week. They killed him. Qaddafi put  out disinformation that it was us...  Who was your source on this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise Kraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...A woman will never know the Middle  East. You're talking about a culture  that keeps its women slipcovered.  Elise Kraft can't tell a Sheik from  the prophylactic of the same name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate the heads up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux rises, offers his hand. As they shake, Elise st her head in the door without knocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, we've got Judge Frankel in -- (as Devereaux turns  around) Oh. Hello, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, don't let me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hub) Sorry. That tip on the landlord looks  solid. The judge will see us right  away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like I should get out of your  way. We're there if you need us. (at the door; to Elise) Your father well, Elise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As can be expected. How's Maggie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of her game. (heads out) Well, go get 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's gone. Elise turns to Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making new friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your lip --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at Hub -- and now she knows that he knows. She  brazens it out:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So... you like to watch --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Just learning about commitment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a full contact sport.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE'S CHAMBERS
dialogues.text: Judge Frankel, 60, puts down his sandwich and wipes his h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're telling me that just because  some Brooklyn landlord tips you off  that he's been paid in cash, you  have the right to call in the cavalry -- ! Hub, as far as I know, paying cash  is not yet a crime in this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not hearing me. This Khalil  was carrying cash for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You've observed him giving cash  to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... No, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But you have hard evidence linking  this apartment to the people that  blew up bus 87 --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elise sits quietly beside Frank, observing Hub's trials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know we'll turn up trace elements  of semtex, chemicals... something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when you do, you'll get your  warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about as a feasibility study?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We enter first, take a look, then  fill out the warrant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the difference between that  and breaking-and-entering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is good enough, Judge? Another  bus? A school, maybe. These things  come in waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waves mean nothing to me; there's  been a wave of violent crime committed  by black people in this city for the  past twenty years, but if you came  to me with a plan to put all black  people behind bars as a preventative  measure I'd send you packing. There's  a price to be paid for living in a  free society --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and not in cash I guarantee it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub catches Elise's eye -- "we're out of here."

dialogues.speaker: THE STAIRCASE OF A TENEMENT
dialogues.text: Elise and Hub climb seemingly endless FLIGHTS OF STAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Not two Judges from now, not two  HOURS from now, not two MINUTES from  now. These guys could split any SECOND  and you've lost your best shot at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank's working another warrant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand, they're pros!  From the age of twelve they've been  dodging people like you, people better  than you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean people like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- no matter how sparkling your record  is, no matter how terrified you are  to fail --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he stops, turns on her:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's... against... the... law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Just because you went to night  school, or filled out the back of a  matchbook or whatever you did to get  a law degree doesn't make you Sir  Thomas More.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just because you talk the talk doesn't  make you an expert. And just because  you read my file doesn't make you an  expert on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna lose them and they're  gonna do another horrible --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You think I want to lose them.  Where do you get off talking that  shit. (controls himself...) If I don't take 'em down properly  they'll be on the street two hours  from now. I could find dynamite,  semtex, plutonium and a book of  matches in there and unless I've got  the right warrant it's all  inadmissible

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
