dialogues.text: They've also got a warrant. A warrant  from God. They're ready to die! And  your quaint laws don't mean shit to  these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My quaint laws? Last I checked you  were an American citizen. And these  happen to be the only laws we got. (turns on her) Look, I'm just a cop, okay, and I'm  real sorry the cold war's over, and  you Masters of the Universe got  nothing going on over there in  Afghanistan or Iraq or wherever --  but you're just not in the Middle  East anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, really...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the top of the stairs where Frank is waiting. dangles a piece of paper -- the warrant -- and grins.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SAME SQUALID APARTMENT BUILDING
dialogues.text: Hub looks through the surveillance equipment focused on a apartment across the street -- paper shades drawn. Wearin set of HEADPHONES, Elise listens intently to the Arabic  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're discussing how hard it is to  find a decent cup of coffee over  here. (hands headset to  Frank) I make out three voices. What do you  have on the infrared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three sounds right. If we had  microwave we'd know for sure. The  CIA's got microwave, how come we  don't have microwave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, meanwhile is question a Syrian Landlord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- three of them. All day long they  watch tv. And eat pizza. Nothing but  pizza, pizza, pizza...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks over at Frank. They've got a way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: DARK HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Mike Johannson, carrying two PIZZAS, knocks on a door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SHADOWS BELOW
dialogues.text: Hub, Frank, and a small army of AGENTS lock and load.

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG ARAB
dialogues.text: Opens the door to the length of a chain and hands Mike a  twenty-dollar bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want change, right --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna open the door, or what --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arab motions, leave them on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, didn't ya hear crime's down  seven-percent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Muttering, he sets the pizza down and heads downstairs. A a moment we HEAR the chain pulled and the door open.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: The Young Arab sets the pizza on an orange crate. Two oth YOUNG ARABS in the next room barely take their eyes off t rerun of "Hunter." But as the young Arab opens the box:

dialogues.speaker: A STUN GRENADE
dialogues.text: Hidden within, EXPLODES with a blinding FLASH, knocking h to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: THE APARTMENT DOOR
dialogues.text: Is blown in as armed AGENTS rush in, Hub leading the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (English and Arabic) FBI --! Lie down on the floor with  your hands behind your back --!

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO OTHER YOUNG ARABS, HOWEVER --
dialogues.text: Have not been affected. Not only were they in the next ro but also their eyes were averted from the FLASH.

dialogues.speaker: THEY COME UP FIRING
dialogues.text: But only get off half a clip each before they are CUT DOW by a fusillade of FBI return-fire.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GROUND
dialogues.text: The Young Arab, momentarily disoriented, stumbles to his  feet, only to be confronted by six armed agents -- all ai at his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The terrorist puts his gun to his mouth and PULLS THE TRI

dialogues.speaker: A STILLNESS
dialogues.text: As the CORDITE drifts lazily toward the ceiling, Hub call out from behind the table:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the others? See if we can  get a pulse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other Agents scurry in to hover over the inert BODIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub picks himself up in time to see Elise, kneeling besid the body of the Young Arab, her hand on his boyish chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got semtex, we got detcord, same  stuff as the bus, the whole  enchilada...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few WHOOPS and high-fives as the adrenaline rush of the firefight abates. Frank opens the remaining box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody like anchovies --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then from across the room, Hub kneels beside an ominous- looking DEVICE. A claymore mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. GODDAMN IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't fire. They had it rigged  to the door and it didn't fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank stares at the lethal booby-trap. Hub shakes his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're too old to be lucky, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: A DOWNTOWN BAR
dialogues.text: Where Mike and Tina are dancing their asses off. Around t other AGENTS from the takedown laugh and drink.

dialogues.speaker: AT A NEARBY TABLE
dialogues.text: Hub and Elise sit, watch them cut loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sips her drink) My first boyfriend was Palestinian.  My father liked to say, they seduce  you with their suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITRESS brings her another drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever been over there --? (he shakes his head,  no) ...The courtesy with which they  welcome you into their homes. And  the people, these incredibly... warm  people in this... austere land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you work against them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only the crazies. I tend to be  suspicious of all true believers. (looks at him) Present company included.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm a fanatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say you don't seem the  ambivalent type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why're are you a fed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what my nephew keeps asking  me. "Why you with The Man, Unc?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Well? What'd you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You read my file. You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see... Catholic school. Captain  of this, president of that. Hard  work, fair play, make a difference,  change the system from within. Rah.  Rah. Rah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was in my file?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Tell me I'm wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...What --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You believe in anything, Elise --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what, for instance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about right and wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's easy to choose between right  and wrong. What's hard is choosing  the wrong that's more right. I just  want to make it all... a little...  better. (finishes her drink) Ignore me. I'm shitfaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank appears to lean over their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So am I --! Hey, Elise... tell us  about being a spook? Ever meet Aldrich  Ames? Weren't you at the Bay of Pigs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in charge of Waco, right -- ? Or was that Ruby Ridge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shah of Iran, Noriega, I love  the way you guys predicted the  collapse of the Soviet Union.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah... And J. Edgar  Hoover wore a dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs and stands up to dance:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Hub...? Peace?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But as he grudgingly stands up, a BALLAD comes on. They s there awkwardly. Finally, he takes her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This feels like high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- only my prom date wasn't packing  a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine's a 9 mm. How big is yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two inches. From the ground. (laughing, they dance  closer) So what's the latest from Samir. I  want a list of every visa he  sponsored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure he'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I once knew this undercover guy,  started to care so much about his  source --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Samir's a source. Period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you considered that he might  also be in bed with the other side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir in bed with them? That would  too much to wish for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so confident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tina watches them. She rolls her eyes at Frank. And then:

dialogues.speaker: THE GROUND SHAKES
dialogues.text: A low RUMBLE as the light FLICKERS and the chandelier swa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa... What do they put in these  drinks --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got earthquakes in Manhattan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Elise is not too drunk to make her way to the door. H joins her. Already, in the distance, the WAILING OF SIREN

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TOWN CAR
dialogues.text: Blue light FLASHING. Hub, Elise and Frank sit grimly sile

dialogues.speaker: TRAFFIC
dialogues.text: Is snarled and gridlocked at 40th. Finally, they can take no longer and step out into a chorus of HONKING HORNS.

dialogues.speaker: THEY BEGIN TO RUN
dialogues.text: Past the frustrated drivers. Turning the corner at 41st w

dialogues.speaker: SMOKE BILLOWS
dialogues.text: From the New Victory Theatre -- where a gala benefit is t place.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL IN A PRADA GOWN
dialogues.text: Walks toward CAMERA. She's stunning. From the jeweled  clutchbag to the tasteful necklace, everything is perfect except:

dialogues.speaker: HER RIGHT ARM IS MISSING
dialogues.text: And now we SEE:

dialogues.speaker: THE BLACK-AND-WHITES
dialogues.text: Haphazardly pulled-up over the steps and the FIRETRUCKS  already unspooling their hoses. Cops, Firemen, EMT's.  Everybody's SCREAMING. Hub and Elise race past.

dialogues.speaker: MAN IN BLACK TIE
dialogues.text: Sits, weeping quietly beneath the once proud stone lions.

dialogues.speaker: THE FEW SURVIVORS
dialogues.text: Their faces cut and bleeding, stumble around, disoriented As Hub and Elise continue toward a SOUND we have never he before in this country. A kind of keening. A NYPD SERGEANT is the senior OFFICER on the scene. Hub s his shield to the man who appears a bit shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- fucking bastards waited 'til  intermission. Everybody standing  around... Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS crunching underfoot, they can only watch as horribl disfigured BODIES are carried out. A NEWS REPORTER shoves microphone in Hub's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true the governor was attending  tonight's benefit --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who it is I'm speaking to --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub ignores the reporter. He sees that Elise is already  tearing off part of her skirt to bandage a SOCIETY MATRON He takes off his coat and goes to work beside her.

dialogues.speaker: A DARKENED AIRPLANE
dialogues.text: Hub sits alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Folks, as you can probably tell, we  have begun our descent into  Washington's National airport.

dialogues.speaker: THE HIGH-PITCHED WHISTLING SOUND IS HEARD AGAIN
dialogues.text: Hub reaches up to his DAMAGED EARS. As anyone who's ever  flown with a sinus problem knows, the pain is excruciatin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can only LIP-READ her question. He's sweating now. Over this, we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either we answer this threat quickly  and convincingly or next week there'll  be a hundred more all over the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: ON CAPITOL HILL
dialogues.text: As Hub climbs the steps toward the gleaming dome, the deb continues within:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds great, General, except why  can't we find out who's behind it -- ?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ROTUNDA LIBRARY
dialogues.text: A strategy session chaired by General Devereaux. Sleeves  rolled up, silver coffee service. Staff members abound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These sects are organized so you  need a kill to your credit to get  inside. It makes undercover operations  impossible. What that leaves us is...  we're working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about who's behind who's behind  this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Libya. Iraq. Iran. Possibly Syria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask a question. Get an atlas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is that we must respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Respond, sure. But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find out who it is and bomb the shit  out of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we can't find out --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question hangs in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look it keeps escalating. First a  bus, then the theatre. What's next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything but leadership.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With all respect, Senator, why don't  we just stipulate that the President  is a dumb son of a bitch so we can  all get down to business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An icebreaker. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about sending in the Guard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The National Guard are trained for  riot control not counter-terrorism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army then. I've seen the  contingency plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's settled legal doctrine, posse  comitatus, that the Army not be turned  against our own people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even if that's what our own people  are asking for, three to one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the President is willing to declare  a State of Emergency --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: President Lincoln declared martial  law in 1862. He suspended --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- which the Supreme Court later  found un-constitutional. Ex parte  Milligan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I've got an election in November.  Ex-United States Congressman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, guys, the President lost a lot  of friends last night --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention six points in the  polls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And his plane lands in two hours.  We owe it to him to have a consensus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't fight a junkyard dog with  ASPCA rules. What you do is take the  leash off your own, bigger, meaner  dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...General?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Army is a broadsword not a  scalpel. You do not want us in an  American city.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But hypothetically... how long would  it take you to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We only go if the President invokes  the War Powers Act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand that, General. Let us  imagine, though, for a moment, that  the order has been given.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Devereaux. As he weighs his remarks, we FLASHCUT almost imperceptibly to:

dialogues.speaker: AN ANONYMOUS ROOM
dialogues.text: As WATER is poured over anonymous hands in a ritualized  manner. O.S. we HEAR the SOUND of chanting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Twelve hours after the President  gives the word we can be on the  ground. One light infantry division  of ten thousand seven hundred men.  Elements of the Rapid Deployment  Force combined with Special Forces --  Delta. APC's, tanks, helicopters.  And of course, the ubiquitous M-16A1  assault rifle, a humble weapon until  you see a man carrying one outside  your local bowling alley or Seven- Eleven. It will be noisy, it will be  scary and it will not be mistaken  for a VFW parade.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Where the same anonymous hands lift a cotton shroud. We w in SLOW-MOTION as it drifts down a shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That means civilian casualties. At a  minimum it's a drunk private joyriding  in a Hummer who runs down an old  lady in Greenpoint. At a maximum... (sighs) Make no mistake. We will hunt the  enemy. We will find the enemy. And  we will kill the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Turning the key in an ignition. An engine rumbles to life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at them) And no card-carrying member of the  ACLU is more deadset against it...  than I am. Which is why I urge you...  no, I implore you not to consider  this option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. The Chief of Staff sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what the President will say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's exactly why you're the only  man for the job.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Emerges from a dark garage like a beast from a cave.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: The Army General speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remind you General Devereaux does  not speak for official Army policy.  A police function has become accepted  as our role in Haiti, in Somalia --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Could I interrupt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks over at Hub. Devereaux smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Anthony Hubbard, FBI. He's  the ASAC on the ground up there.  They took out the first cell less  than 36 hours after bus 87. I suggest  we hear what he has to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He nods to Hub, who acknowledges the vote of confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is something you probably  haven't thought about doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that is --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Don't over-react. (off their incredulity) With all respect, gentlemen, I'm  just a cop. To you these people may  be martyrs, but to me they're  criminals. And a criminal is no more  than somebody who thinks he's better  than everyone else. And he's not  better. He only has to be wrong once.  And that's where we come in. We run  down a tip from a landlord, or we  pick up a latent print from a bus.  Our phones are ringing off the hook  with people from the Arab community  wanting to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He measures his words carefully. Unaccustomed to these ki of august circumstances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They love this country and they hate  that these criminals are giving them  a bad name. With their help and some  old-fashioned shoe leather, we'll  nail these guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Amen to that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Agent Hubbard. I, too,  think we should proceed cautiously. (looks around) Now we've got an Agency briefing  prepared... Some of you may not know  Sharon Bridger. Sharon was posted in  Iraq as part of our covert operations  during the Gulf War. -- Sharon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- HUB as, from behind him, comes a familiar VOI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all know the traditional model of  a terrorist network. One cell  controlling all others. Cut off the  head and the body will wither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks to the back of the room at Elise, who's no long Elise. She looks blithely at Hub as if nothing is amiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately the old wisdom no longer  applies. The new paradigm is like  the myth of the Hydra. Each cell  exists independent of the other. Cut  off one head and another rises up in  its place.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Crossing the Brooklyn Bridge, keeping well below the spee limit. In the distance, the glass towers of Manhattan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bus 87 was the work of Cell #1. Its  elimination only activated the work  of Cell #2 -- the theatre gala.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: Turns up Wall Street. Frank Haddad and Danny exit THE FED BUILDING. They pass Mike and Fred, heading back in. Somet about the van causes Frank to take notice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Cell #3? How do we find Cell #3?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone looks to Sharon/Elise. Hub looks at her, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question hangs in the air. She's thinking about somet What?

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: JUMPS THE CURB and heads across the plaza on A COLLISION  COURSE with the glass lobby of the FEDERAL BUILDING. Fran and Danny are rooted to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Close on Sharon/Elise. As time elongates. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE SCREEN, (ALL SOUND OUT)
dialogues.text: Puffy clouds in a blue sky. As we TILT DOWN into:

dialogues.speaker: THE GUTTED RUIN
dialogues.text: Of what was once the Federal Building. RESCUE WORKERS hun for SURVIVORS as others carry BODY BAGS toward waiting  AMBULANCES. Hub stands sentinel to the grisly process as  indeed he has stood there all night. Frank is beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Are they confirmed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fred, Whitney, we're waiting on who  else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A JEEP pulls up and Elise/Sharon gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their silence speaks volumes. With Sharon is an OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Colonel Hardwick. Army  Intelligence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands) Anthony Hubbard. Average intelligence. (clocking him) But 'til I hear otherwise this is  still my show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here as an advisor only. I intend  to keep a low profile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be insensitive, but  what, exactly, are your capabilities  at this point? Your... infrastructure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're standing on our infrastructure.  Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub walks back toward the rubble. Sharon watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: HUB'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Sofas have been pushed against the wall. Hub's apartment serves as a temporary command post. Agents huddle togethe poring over the charred or soggy remnants of files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- They managed to get a partial  VIN# off the van. DMV says it was  reported stolen the day before in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fiber thinks they've come up with a  piece of the shroud. Egyptian cotton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank joins them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) We just got a confirmation on Mike.  He was with Fred in the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many does that make it --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A KNOCK on the door. They look at one another. One of the agents answers it. Elise/Sharon. She walks over to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm... very sorry... about your  friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving her nothing) Frank. This is Sharon. (to her) -- I didn't catch the last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Bridger. How ya doin' Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Takes from her purse a folder, labeled in Hebre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agency has come up with another  list of probables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes out photos. Neither Hub nor Frank react. She pu them on the coffee table. No one reaches for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should circulate them. (they stonewall her:) Hey, this stuff may be good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was there no warning from Samir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he didn't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says Samir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll ask him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over my dead body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over six hundred dead bodies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at one another. Both are tired and raw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, he's one of the good guys.  Okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the fuck can you be so sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he helped me recruit the  network in Iraq. OKAY?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were part of the operation to  destabilize Saddam Hussein. Printing  up fake dinars, arming the Kurds --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and financing the Sheik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's Iraqi. He was going to be our  Ayatollah Khomeini --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And help bring down Saddam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran the network. Samir was the go- between. He risked his life for us  over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who are they? Give me names, Give  me pictures. Not some history lesson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't give you pictures because I  don't know what they look like. We  did everything at arm's length.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you got nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got Samir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has he had any contact with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minimal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't. They initiate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And otherwise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's waiting? What's he waiting for?  More bodies? We got lots more  buildings in midtown, maybe he's  waiting to see how many they can  blow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know how you must feel --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU DON'T KNOW SHIT HOW I FEEL -- MY  FRIENDS ARE DEAD. HUNDREDS OF PEOPLE  ARE DEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll make contact soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?... Why soon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him, refusing to divulge anything more. Sudd Hub grabs her arm and roughly shoves her into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (viciously) What's the tradecraft, Sharon?  Ironsites, visuals? I love all that  spy shit. (still, she says  nothing) I'm gonna haul your boy downtown,  strap his ass to a polygraph and ask  him all about you. Then I'm gonna  send the transcripts to a friend of  mine at the Times who just loves to  write about the latest CIA link to  some political horror show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You burn him, you lose any chance  you ever had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lose-lose from here on in, who  said that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you possibly remember who  you're fucking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slaps him, hard. Without hesitation he slaps her back She claws at his face, but he grabs her wrist and bends h arm behind her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need... more time. Please. You're  hurting me. Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something in the violence of the moment is more than a li charged.

dialogues.speaker: THE SURVEILLANCE OF SHARON AND SAMIR
dialogues.text: A dead drop by a hot dog stand. Out for her morning jog. series of FREEZE FRAMES as the motordrive CLICKS AND WHIR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except they're not saying anything  worth listening to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: IN A HAMMAM, (BATH-HOUSE)
dialogues.text: Samir chats with a couple of older men in the steaming wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One's his uncle, he owns the place.  The other's a doctor. They check out  clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He go there every day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A clean body and a pure heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Tonight we take a close look at the  tragic sight of a city under siege."

dialogues.speaker: HUB'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Hub sits on his sofa, watching the special report. Spread out before him, the surveillance PHOTOS of Sharon and Sam

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO CLIPS
dialogues.text: A deserted Times Square. Police checking packages of shop in front of a department store. Long lines of security at bus stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank are walking downtown. At a stoptlight, A BU idles beside them, a POLICEMAN onboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- claiming responsibility for the  bombing. In other news, a cab driver  was beaten and his cab set on fire.  The driver, Rashid Abu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the Jews, man. When they say,  jump, we say, how high. I say we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If you're on the State Department  Terrorist Watch list you cannot get  into this country. But Ali Waziri  was on the watch list, and he got  in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call the State Department?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me to call INS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me to call State.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you just love government?

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: Is only the BUS backfiring. PEDESTRIANS who have thrown  themselves to the ground, screaming, now pick themselves Laughing. Only Hub and Frank are not laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "As many fled, there were others who  stayed behind to pay the price...

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO CLIPS
dialogues.text: Jammed freeways; A LOOTED corner deli, its Arab owners,  bloodied: POLICE checking backpacks at an elementary scho

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, as hundreds of law enforcement  officials gathered in a Broadway  theatre, outside people wanted  answers.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO CLIPS
dialogues.text: Angry people, scared people. Hub, being interviewed about the coordinated efforts of law enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Already there is talk of a protest  march by a coalition of --

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE THEATRE, (A VIDEO CLIP TURNS BACK TO FILM)
dialogues.text: Hub and a few others sit on the stage. Two hundred law  enforcement officials fill the orchestra seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PEOPLE OF THIS CITY HAVE A RIGHT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- THE PURPOSE OF THIS MEETING --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- IS TO MAKE THIS CITY SAFE...! And  your department --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My department WHAT, ASSHOLE...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon stands at the back, meets Hub's eye, and waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys... GUYS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EVERYBODY'S talking at once. In frustration, Hub covers a microphone with his hand. The FEEDBACK silences the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. From now on, we will raise  our hands and wait to be called on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An appreciative chuckle. Hub points to A MAN IN A SUIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard Kaplan. INS. So we've pulled  every ethnic visa in the city and  traced them to source. Who wants em?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We bring 'me in, have a talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about translators --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many people we talking about  here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixteen hundred, maybe more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell we gonna put sixteen  hundred people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone again begins speaking at once. Hub takes control

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a military presence at  JFK and LaGuardia --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think we're there yet. It's  also not going to stop these people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about protecting the Arab  population? There's a lot of anger --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I represent the American-Arab Anti- Discrimination Committee. Whatever  injustices my people may be suffering  at this difficult moment, we will  continue to show our patriotism and  our commitment to this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. And to everyone else  for their patience today. These are  extremely difficult times -- London,  Paris, we're not the first city to  have to deal with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pauses a moment, searching for the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Tel Aviv, the day after they blew  up the market, the market was full. (looks out at them) This is New York. We can take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then two hundred BEEPERS all go off at once. Everyone looks at one another. Dear God, what now... A GRAINY BLACK & WHITE VIDEO IMAGE Kids, huddled in a corner, crying. A dead mom. The legs o what we imagine is the terrorist. We are in:

dialogues.speaker: AN ELEMENTARY SCHOOL
dialogues.text: Hub huddles with other agents behind a makeshift blast- barricade of desks and tables. Sharon kneels beside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- one of the moms was carrying a  piece, wounds the guy as he's planting  the device. He kills her and locks  them all in. (points at video) Up there in the corner... by the  clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The probe is a hot-head, "arthroscopic" video camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's got a timer on it only we  don't know how much time is left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hub stares at the horrifying image, the WHITE-NOISE re and begins to GROW in his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closer on the timer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying but the angle's wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOISE in Hub's head continues to grow. And then sudde it is compounded by the SOUND of an APPROACHING CHOPPER - as an NYPD SWAT HELICOPTER lowers itself into view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is the NYPD doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Somebody must have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- WE'VE RUN DRILLS ON THIS  JURISDICTION BULLSHIT SINCE --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I KNOW --! YOU THINK I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUIT BICKERING AND FIX IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the HELICOPTER -- a Marksman raises a sniper's rifle.

dialogues.speaker: THE WHITE NOISE
dialogues.text: Is screaming now in Hub's head. Unimaginable. Unbearable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his radio) NYPD SWAT, this is the FBI. Get that  bird the fuck out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SOUND of the CHOPPER and the WHITE NOISE drown him ou

dialogues.speaker: ON THE VIDEO MONITOR
dialogues.text: Children are SCREAMING without sound. Even the chopper is drowned out by the WHITE NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: The MARKSMAN takes careful aim --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CLASSROOM
dialogues.text: The TERRORIST grabs a child as a human shield. Hub closes his eyes to the imminent nightmare, and then:

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY, WITHOUT WARNING --
dialogues.text: He takes off, barreling down the hall, toward the locked  door of the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR SPLINTERS
dialogues.text: He flies through it, firing, hitting the TERRORIST twice.

dialogues.speaker: AN EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: Much like the first one on Bus 99. Hub throws himself ove several SCREAMING CHILDREN. And for a moment we don't kno if they'll live or die, until: BLUE PAINT covers them all. Agents pour in, followed by  Sharon. There, on the floor, holding as many weeping chil as he can:

dialogues.speaker: HUB
dialogues.text: Who, unable to keep up the facade for a single second mor is also weeping now. Weeping for the victims of the bombi weeping for the children who've survived, weeping for him And for a moment, everyone just... stands there, vaguely  embarrassed, and more than a little moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub sits in his boxers, toweling blue paint from his hair listening to the CNN report of the school attack. A KNOCK the door. He pulls on his pants. It's Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just came in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Hub another fax: "Last Warning. Release Him." H looks at it and hands it back to her without a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My neck's a little stiff, that's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a long look) That's not what I meant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stand awkwardly in the doorway for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want a drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks over and opens a bottle of scotch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a pretty crazy thing you  did today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't respond. Hands her the drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a drink. Then another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to -- I... just didn't feel  like... being alone... tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Samir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could call him. Maybe he'd join  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might. Or I could call Tina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I thought Samir'd be an easy  recruit. He wasn't. It was crazy but  I did what I had to do. (looks at him) You know as well as I do, running an  agent can be very... complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about running an FBI agent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'm trying to run you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at her) ...Why else are you here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring right back) ...You know why I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a charged moment. They're two sad and lonely people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they embrace, their ferocity and desperation is some more than comfort and less than love. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHIEF OF STAFF'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: The Chief of Staff is working late in a cardigan sweater. Devereaux, in his impeccable suit, stands opposite him. E at ease he is smartly erect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FBI received another fax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmed Bin Talal. They're still under  the impression that we have him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we? Have him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To refresh your memory, as I told  you last time, it was the Libyans  who --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember perfectly well what you  said last time. (looks at him) Do we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux frosts him with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me give you some free advice,  son. Don't get between me and the  President. You might break a nail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am speaking for the President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and Devereaux look at each other. It is the moment of  plausible deniability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as the President is  concerned... No, we do not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chief of Staff accepts the answer because it serves h for now. And because he has a more pressing agenda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, do you know that after  yesterday's attack, half the parents  in this country kept their children  out of school --? (Devereaux nods) ...They're attacking our way of life.  It's got to stop. And the President  cannot afford to be weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the subtext) Are you saying the President is  prepared to take the necessary  steps...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying, the President is prepared  to be... Presidential.

dialogues.speaker: HUB'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: A ringing phone. Hub wakes up in a tangle of sheets. He l around and realizes he is alone. Did last night even happ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hubbard... What --? ...Slow down,  slow down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the remote control, turns on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: A GRINDING OF TREADS ON ASPHALT
dialogues.text: as THE FIRST APC enters Brooklyn. Followed by another. An another. And in a sound bite: General Devereaux, IN FATIG FOR THE FIRST TIME, and looking like grim death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Today, with the invocation of the  War Powers Act by the President, I  am declaring a state of martial law  in this city.

dialogues.speaker: THE BATTLE OF BROOKLYN HAS BEGUN
dialogues.text: Road blocks set up at select intersections. Random stop-a frisk. Patrols of young soldiers in the streets. GANG KID same age, same color, eye them warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the best of our knowledge, we are  opposed by no more than twenty of  the enemy. He is hiding among a  population of roughly two million.

dialogues.speaker: THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Is closed. SOLDIERS in full battle-dress stop cars, check trunks, handbags, briefcases, and id's. THE LINE OF HONKI ANGRY MOTORISTS stretches as far as the eye can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Intelligence tells us he is most  likely Arab-speaking, between the  age of fourteen and thirty. Narrowing  the target to fifteen thousand  suspects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SWARTHY TEENAGER is pulled from A CAR by a SERGEANT and led away to a CAMOUFLAGED TENT set up on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can further reduce that number  down to those who have been in this  country less than six months. Now  you have twenty hiding among two  thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CAR TRUNK is inspected. Two women waved through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you are one of these twenty young  men, you can hide among a population  of similar ethnic background.  Unfortunately for you, you can only  hide there. And that population, in  the classic immigration pattern, is  concentrated. Right here in Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub and Sharon stare at the Orwellian tableau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We intend to seal off this borough.  And then we intend to squeeze it.  This is the land of opportunity,  gentlemen. The opportunity to turn  yourselves in. After sundown tonight  any young man fitting the profile I  described who has not cooperated  will be arrested and detained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub and Sharon show their ID's to an MP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you follow me, please. The  General is expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads him to A CAMOUFLAGED TENT on the service roadway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is historically nothing more  corrosive to the morale of an army  than policing its own citizens.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE TENT
dialogues.text: The swarthy teenager is being interrogated by COL. HARDWI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the enemy would be sadly mistaken  if they were to doubt our resolve.  They are now face to face with the  most fearsome killing machine in the  history of man. And I intend to use  it. And be back on base in time for  the play-offs... That is all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux sees Hub and strides over to him:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub. Good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't say the same, sir. Not in  that uniform. I thought you were  against this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am against it. It wasn't my call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I'm only following orders" didn't  work at Nuremberg. It may not be  your policy but they're your tactics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your operation had its chance, Hub,  and you couldn't get it done. You're  down three touchdowns. Time to bring  in the first string.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against our own team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux suddenly goes ice cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you questioning my patriotism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm questioning your judgement, yes,  sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, I want you to take a moment and  reflect on my life as a soldier. I  have a dozen tropical diseases I'll  never entirely get rid of. I set off  metal detectors with the shrapnel in  my ass. I have watched men die and I  have killed. Now I am serving my  President and quite possibly not the  best interests of my country, but my  profession doesn't afford me the  luxury of that distinction. I won't  question your patriotism but don't  you ever again question my command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not under your command, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a good look around, my friend,  and tell me that's still true. (softening his tone) But we're not shutting you out. In  fact, I can't do it without you,  Hub. I need men like you. Men willing  to put it on the line like you did  in that schoolroom. (gestures to his  uniform) These stars mean I have been putting  it on the line for thirty years...  and never made a mistake worth  remembering. Don't tell me I made a  mistake about you.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Hub and Sharon exit the command tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ironic) They're not shutting us out. They  need men like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll fuck it up, the arrogant prick.  You ever met anybody so in love with  the sound of his own voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're putting Samir in play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now? With all this going on? He's  freaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, he's high-strung. Only  you can manage him. You and the CIA  and the DIA and God-knows-who-else  you're really working for --! (seething) Get back in there, Sharon, Elise,  whatever the fuck your name is --  They'll probably make you a Colonel...  if you're not one already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gestures at the military leviathan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All this... is no more in our interest  than it is in yours, Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, exactly, are your interests,  Sharon? You protect Samir, you protect  the agency. You're interested in  protecting everything but your  country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea what I do for my  country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, and I don't want to know. With  you or without you we're putting  Samir in play. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at him for a long moment. Considering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more lamb to the slaughter.

dialogues.speaker: A HALF-OPENED DOOR OF AN APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Samir looks and sees Hub, standing beside Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God. Oh, my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to SLAM the door, but they force it open. He gra A FAT JOINT from an ashtray and hurries into the bathroom

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sharon) Does he understand the difference  between the FBI and the DEA?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir... It's fine, he's cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSIDE, the sound of gunfire. Samir reappears, wild-eyed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to that --! Are you listening?  They're killing Arabs out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can stop it all right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about --? The  army is here. They're setting up  interrogation centers right now.  They're torturing people in cellars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just calm down for a second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I've got to get out of here. You  have to help me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes over and peers out the drawn curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gentling a horse) We'll take care of you... don't worry.  You just have to calm down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money... I must have more money...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You got a student visa for Ali  Waziri. Because... somebody asked  you to -- Didn't they --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... got it myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon CRACKS him across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's Samir's turn to taste the blood in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... tell him... what he wants to  know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sharon) Hey, that's enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows. He fucking knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's crazy. They're ghosts. Jinn.  They'd never trust someone like me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop simpering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a picture of the two of us,  do you remember that picture, Samir? (the mask coming off:) I'm going to post that picture in  every mosque in Brooklyn. And then  I'm gonna send copies to some friends  of mine on the West Bank. You've got  family there, don't you --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub jumps up, takes Sharon by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gives her the BUM'S RUSH out of the apartment, shuts t door, then turns back to Samir, who sits, ashen-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... Nobody's going to burn you,  nobody's going to call anybody -- (sits beside him) -- Who asked you to get that visa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir is trembling. Tears roll down his cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be afraid. I can protect you.  There's nothing to be afraid of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid of going to hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub just sits there. He knows he's got him. Finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His name is Tariq Husseini. He runs  an auto shop. (Hub waits for more --) ...on Commerce Street in Red Hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him a card) My beeper number. Anybody messes  with you, I'm there in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets up and walks into:

dialogues.speaker: THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Where Sharon waits. As they head for the stairs we HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not so bad yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we are HEARING IT along with:

dialogues.speaker: COL. HARDWICK
dialogues.text: In a nearby SURVEILLANCE VEHICLE -- where, through the ne microwave technology (the kind the FBI don't yet have), h has OVERHEARD the entire conversation.

dialogues.speaker: ON A NOTEPAD
dialogues.text: In his lap, the name, "Tariq Husseini."

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE SAMIR'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: They are in a housing project. Hub dials his cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You calling Devereaux.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't get his number. Darn. (on the phone) Floyd, Hub. We need to put something  together in a big-ass hurry... Where's  Frank --?... Give him a 911.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A YELLOW SCHOOL BUS pulls up beside them and armed soldie hop out. Sharon watches them as Hub continues:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) -- and find some kind of beat-up  car... Well, beat it up yourself if  you have to... 896 Commerce St...  it's a garage in Red Hook... but  remember -- (looks at her) -- they're pros.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PSY-OPS VAN passes by, broadcasting through a P.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- all persons without proper  authorization must be off the street  until seven a.m. Failure to comply  will result in immediate arrest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The announcement is then repeated in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: ROUNDING A CORNER
dialogues.text: They come upon several more YELLOW SCHOOL BUSES. From wit the various apartments the SHRILL PROTESTS of mothers and sisters as YOUNG MEN fitting the "terrorist profile" are  hustled into the BUSES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq will go to ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hit him in less than an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turns to leave) Hit him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to stash Samir someplace  safe. (as she goes) Go with God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub hurries on toward his car, passing TEENAGE GIRLS,  defiantly wearing Keffiyahs, who mill about, taunting sol with obscenities in English and Arabic. AN APC drives past, further inflaming their passions. Suddenly, A volley ROCKS AND BOTTLES come hurtling out of nowhere, smashing harmlessly against the armor. The teena laugh. And then, the sudden CONCUSSION of a small BLAST from UP STREET. The teenagers SCREAM and scatter. Hub SPRINTS tow A SMOKING CAR, pulling his weapon from his hip. A SOLDIER IS ROLLING ON THE GROUND, SCREAMING beside a PA CAR. His leg is shredded. ARMORED JEEPS come squealing ar a corner. M-16's are locked, loaded and leveled at Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FBI --! FBI --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a moment, it's touch-and-go as the the terrified RECR just weeks out of basic training, decide whether to SHOOT On the ground, the injured soldier keeps SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now... I'm gonna... reach... into my  jacket... and show you... my shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop your weapon --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub drops the gun and shows his credentials. The young so approaches warily as MEDICS attend to the wounded man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Sir. Somebody's booby-trapping  cars... We're all a little spooked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The RATTLE of small-arms fire is HEARD from up the street In the distance, a running FIGURE is chased by three SOLD The transformation is complete: Brooklyn as Gaza.

dialogues.speaker: REACHING HIS CAR
dialogues.text: Hub climbs in. On a nearby pock-marked wall, a single wor "Intifada."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub, who sits in a beat-up old car, a baseball cap worn  backwards on his head. He keys his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All Units, report in turn. If talking  will reveal your position, just key  your walkie...

dialogues.speaker: AN OLD WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Inside, an AUTO GARAGE. Hoists, compression cylinders,  archwelders. Outside, two WINOS share a bottle by the cur A BEAT-UP DODGE drives up. In it, two scruffy-looking Bla MEN. Upon close inspection we realize that one is Hub. Th other is Floyd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to a mechanic) Yo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mechanic looks out from under a car. He's Hispanic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Que Pasa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mechanic gestures to a partitioned-office in the back As Hub heads toward it, he checks out the other workers: teenager doing a compression check, another fixes a tire.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE OFFICE
dialogues.text: Tariq is on the phone talking in Arabic as Hub enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq holds up a finger, hold on. Hub sits opposite him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Tariq Husseini?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn. Do you think you could give  him a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him the FBI is after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're joking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very... slowly... put your hands on  top of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq notices that Hub's hands are out of sight beneath t table. Hub draws back the slide of his the weapon with an audible CLICK. Tariq mutters a CURSE in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wouldn't be a racist epithet,  now would it? Stand up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Tariq stands, Hub crosses behind him, kicks out his le pats him down, and cuffs him.

dialogues.speaker: MEANWHILE
dialogues.text: The two winos have revealed themselves as shotgun-wieldin FBI agents and are now ROUSTING the garage workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before Hub can answer, an AMPLIFIED VOICE is heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq Husseini, this is the United  States Army. You are surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub is as surprised as Tariq.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have thirty seconds to throw out  any weapons and exit the premises  with your hands on top of your head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the agents with the shotgun calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do as he says.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hub hustles Tariq to his feet, the other agents start hustle the workers out of door, when:

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNG MECHANIC
dialogues.text: Reaches into his overalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FREEZE--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But when the Mechanic pulls his hand out from his overall all he is holding is the pin to a GRENADE.

dialogues.speaker: THE EXPLOSION
dialogues.text: Kills both the FBI agents and their prisoners. Hub throws Tariq to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: FROM AN UPPER WINDOW
dialogues.text: An AUTOMATIC WEAPON opens fire on the Army presence.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE
dialogues.text: Devereaux responds with a dispassionate intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code blue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His order unleashes an overwhelming display of FIREPOWER.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Hub and Tariq crawl for cover as windows EXPLODE, walls a SHREDDED, and incendiary TRACER rounds mix with solvents gasoline to start a conflagration. With the vaguely  hallucinatory quality of the S.L.A. shootout, WHITE NOISE bleeds in and ALL SOUND FADES OUT:

dialogues.speaker: AN M-60 TANK, (SILENT)
dialogues.text: Races in from around the corner, only to be hit by A ROCK PROPELLED GRENADE fired through the second floor window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Code Red.

dialogues.speaker: TWO APACHE ATTACK HELICOPTERS, (SILENT)
dialogues.text: Appear from their hiding place behind a nearby building. they dive into their attack trajectory --

dialogues.speaker: HUB, (SILENT)
dialogues.text: Crawls, dragging Tariq toward the doors as:

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAIN GUN, (SILENT)
dialogues.text: Of the Attack helicopter fires 2,000 rounds a minute --  virtually UNZIPPING the warehouse -- softening it for THE TWO HYDRA ROCKETS that reduce it instantly to a huge FIRE

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: Watches the awesome display of firepower with calm detach

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE WAREHOUSE
dialogues.text: Stagger, blinded, out of the inferno. Hub drags a half- conscious Tariq, where they are pounced on by commandos.

dialogues.speaker: THE STADIUM
dialogues.text: Pac's and Tanks ring the stadium. An anti-terrorist perim has been established -- concrete obstacles, sandbags and  razor-wire. Musco-lights cast their pitiless glow.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE PERIMETER
dialogues.text: A mob of frightened parents, girlfriends, and furious fat A LAWYER for the ACLU confronts a young Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- just want to know if my client's  name is on the list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, the list will be updated every  twelve hours and posted in the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gaggle of JOURNALISTS try to force their way in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- This pass GUARANTEES... You CAN'T --  ...the first FUCKING AMENDMENT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will be a pool briefing for  all accredited journalists at 0700  hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub shows his ID. Is allowed to enter into:

dialogues.speaker: THE DARK STADIUM TUNNEL
dialogues.text: A MUFFLED CRY that might or might not have come from some in pain. His footsteps ECHO as he walks out to where:

dialogues.speaker: 2,000 DETAINEES
dialogues.text: All young men between the ages of sixteen and thirty are  milling about. Squatting, smoking, pacing, some laughing, most looking terrified. All spread across:

dialogues.speaker: THE HALOGEN-LIT FOOTBALL FIELD
dialogues.text: Armed GUARDS backlit in the upper tiers. Enlisted men pas out blankets and soup. Nearby, Hub sees Tina, standing qu still -- Finally, she is able to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1942, my father was put into the  camps at Manzanar. Until the end of  the war. Two years. Now he roots for  the Dodgers and swears it could never  happen again.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Hub asks for Devereaux, is directed across the field, thr an aisle in the wire cages. FRANK HADDAD looms out of the shadows. He looks terrible, drawn. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They got Frankie. My kid's here  someplace --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, slow down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting back tears  of rage) He's only thirteen, for Chrissake --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearby, the "Allahuh Akbar," call, to evening PRAYER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They came into my house. My wife  told them who I was -- (swallows hard) How many times did I put it on the  line, Hub --? How many times --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're American citizens, twenty years.  Ten years in the bureau -- They  knocked her down... and took him.  Out of my own house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's wrong, Frank. What can I say to  you, but it's... all... terribly...  horribly... wrong. (takes his arm) Now, come with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I've got to find him. Besides,  this is where I belong. (takes out his wallet,  hands over his badge) Here. I'm not their sand nigger  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub watches as he he walks away. A MUEZZIN chants the cal to evening prayer. Frank drops to his knees and joins the rest of the prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: Has been transformed in a COMMAND POST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And his name is Haddad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank... Haddad. Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His father's a Shiite. We're checking  him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check this out, pal. His father's a  federal agent for ten years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get in my face, Hubbard. I  might decide you're an Ethiopian.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're just stupid enough to  think that's an insult.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a mistake's been made we'll fix  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no "if". I'm vouching for  this kid. I want him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I said we will look into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, like you're looking into  me? Surveilling me? Breaking up my  operations? If I'd known I was going  to have to do your job for you I  would never have left the army.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an FBI office in Anchorage,  Agent Hubbard. Fuck with me and you'll  be learning a hundred and fifty new  words for snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tariq Husseini is my prisoner. I  want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prisoner is being interrogated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux just looks at him as we CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE TILED SHOWER ROOM
dialogues.text: Tariq is strapped, NAKED, into a folding metal chair. His head lolls on his chest, his eyes are dulled. On a nearby table, an empty syringe. Two MP'S stand guard. Sharon is speaking softly to him in Arabic. Suddenly, Tar SPITS in her face. She wipes it off as if it is nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been at it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not long enough, apparently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much longer, do you think, before  he gives up the other cells --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't give up the other cells if  he doesn't know about them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gestures to Sharon) What about her briefing? The strategy  session -- she said the cells don't  know about each other, that they --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux ignores him. Turns to Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long before he breaks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At this rate. Too long. The theatre  was hit nine hours after we took  down the first cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- what other models do we have -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one wants to be the first to step into uncharted terra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about it, Sharon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Won't work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works for the Israelis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only in conjunction with sleep  deprivation. Needs at least thirty- six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub stares at Sharon -- as the dark side of her professio life is revealed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have thirty-six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another silence. They're teetering on the edge of the aby

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Electric shock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The neurotransmitters just shut down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palestinian authority is producing  good intel using water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub finally can't take another second. Even in theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you people insane --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The time has come for one man to  suffer in order to save the lives of  hundreds

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about two men? How about three?  How about public executions, that  might work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome to wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General... you've lost men, I've  lost men... but what you're doing...  It doesn't work in Belfast. It doesn't  work in Gaza. And it won't work here. (it comes slowly at  first, then in a  rush:) -- What if... they don't want their  leader back at all? You said yourself,  we don't even have him. Maybe what  they really want -- is that we herd  our children into stadiums. Put  soldiers into our streets. Radicalize  people who want to think of themselves  as Americans. Bend the law, shred  the constitution. (searches for the  kind of words that  come so hard to him:) Because if we torture him -- and  let's call it what it is... You...  and I... then the country men like  us have sworn to defend. And bled to  defend. And died to defend... is  gone. (a deep breath) And they've won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gen. Devereaux stares hard at Hub. And then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Col. Hardwick) I think we have to soundproof the  room before we begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks at Sharon, who looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escort him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two MPs lead Hub out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get this over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE LOCKER ROOM
dialogues.text: Sharon emerges from the shower room. She is shattered. Th blood drained from her face. As if carrying with her all sin that was committed in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: FROM INSIDE THE SHOWER ROOM
dialogues.text: The sound of a GUNSHOT. The door opens and Devereaux emer in the torment of a man of honor who is living a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knew nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Devereaux turns and walks off down the corridor. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE LINCOLN MEMORIAL
dialogues.text: Glorious, alabaster stone -- floodlit at night. A symbol all that is good and free and just. Hub drives a rental c staring out at the monuments.

dialogues.speaker: IN GEORGETOWN
dialogues.text: Hub pulls up to a lovely TOWNHOUSE. Parked on the street, UNMARKED CAR from the Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHIEF OF STAFF
dialogues.text: Opens the door, wearing a Dartmouth lacrosse team t-shirt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon in, we're still trying to get  the last one down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the background, we HEAR a three-year-old crying.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Tasteful antiques, rag rugs and kids' toys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...The President wants this shit  over with. There's only one way to  do that. (looks at Hub) Let the Sheik go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we do have the Sheik?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think our government operates as  a single coherent entity? Devereaux  just... pushed the agenda. (carefully) Of course the President was completely  unaware of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (return of serve) Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we can't just let him go. America  has to stand tall in the world yadda  yadda yadda. So what we do is... (the punch line) We let the American justice system  do its work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His wife appears, holding a squalling baby, looking defea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Honey...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be right up, darling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grits her teeth and goes upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have kids? They're great.  Sometimes you just want to... drug  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, let the justice  system do its work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't release him. A judge releases  him. You're an FBI man. That's what  judges are good at, right? (off Hub's look) It's not like we've gone after him  in proper prosectorial fashion.  Kidnaping him. Holding him in  isolation. "Fruit of the poisoned  tree" -- remember that one from law  school? Oh, we'll have a big trial.  Everybody'll get their rocks off...  But the fact is -- (the punch line) -- the sheik will walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at Hub, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...And this whole episode becomes  nothing more than the news cycle  before the next news cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hands Hub an ACCORDION FILE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Documentary evidence of Devereaux's  whole operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you'll know what to do with  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks at the file in his hands. Considering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who. How much is she  complicit in all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks up. Sharon emerges from the hallway. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREETS OF GEORGETOWN
dialogues.text: Hub and Sharon sit in silence in Hub's rental car:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ran an Iraqi network for two years.  Samir recruited them from among the  Sheik's followers. I trained them in  the North. Then we played them back  into Baghdad, two, three at a time,  hiding them in the mosques...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice softens just a bit as memory takes over.
