dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was gonna be beautiful. (looks away) -- And then there was a policy shift --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She thought telling the story would be easy, but there's enormous well of untapped feeling. She fights it back:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- The new doctrine was: Iran will  be too powerful if Iraq falls apart. (her voice trembles) And it's not like... we sold them  out. Exactly. We just... stopped...  helping them. And I wasn't allowed  to tell them what was coming down. I  was ordered not to tell them. (fighting back tears) -- And they got slaughtered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to understand -- these  people... believe. Paradise. Bliss.  To us they're just words. But to  them... It's very beautiful, actually.  And when you look at their lives,  the heartbreak... And what do we do?  We think, aha, we can take advantage  of that. (losing it) So I quit. I came home. I just  can't... do it... anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't want to reveal herself this way. Doesn't want be vulnerable. Doesn't want to cling to him. For a moment puts his arms around her, but it's like holding a beautif dangerous predator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But first, you helped them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She senses the hardness in his tone. Looks up at him, and through tears, puts her game face back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were being slaughtered. They  needed to get out. But they were on  the watch list. So you got them visas.  You and Samir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised we would take care of  them. They were working... for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you trained them. Tradecraft.  Subversion. That's what you said,  right? (she nods) Only you left something out, didn't  you... Didn't you, Sharon? (she can't bring  herself to look at  him) You taught them how to make bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tears are streaming down her face now. Finally, she n

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And now they're here, doing what  you taught 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The streetlight catches Sharon's face. Her eyes are haunt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to have to live with  the hell of that for the rest of my  life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- the people of Brooklyn will not  be held hostage! This afternoon,  join community and religious leaders  in a march to protest the mass arrests --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing out leaflets) March on city hall. Today. No fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank are standing outside Hub's car, each on opp sides, blocking any opportunity to suveil what is happeni within. Sharon sits inside with Samir. She uses a SCALPEL to make the slightest INCISION under Samir's arm. The RADIO plays

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you decide to go on walkabout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the incision she inserts a tiny plastic TRANSMITTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you make contact?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is Afghani. Ahhhh. He got word to  my uncle at the bath-house. You never  met him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're sure he'll show up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling) Sharon, they are all dead but the  last cell and they are crazy with  fear. Just tell me the message and I  will pass it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to deliver it in person.  Believe me, they'll want to hear  what I have to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns off the radio.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank glance inconspicuously around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You watch the game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a piece of paper he has scribbled, "Hit Hardwick. Safe House. 11:00."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods yes, then:) Kannell was really on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub then writes. "Bath-house. 12:00."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods again) Think they'll make the play-offs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub looks at him. There's been little time for sentiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's alright. Thanks for getting him  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon steps out of the car. In her hands is a device  resembling a PORTABLE OSCILLOSCOPE. A green dot appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Samir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks in at Samir) Green is about right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He slips Sharon the scribbled notes. As she looks at them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's terrified. Then again, so am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure he'll go through with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he doesn't he knows I'll give him  to Devereaux. (She mouths, "They  out there?" Hub nods) How's it feel to be on the other end  of it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like watching better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the endgame, you understand  that? If this goes wrong --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's going wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're the CIA, something always goes  wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car door opens and Samir steps out, buttoning his shi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose there's any way you  would trust me to do this on my own? (off his look) I thought not. Well, in case it gets  hairy, remember... the most committed  wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub watches as she and Samir walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust her about as far as I can  throw her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That far?

dialogues.speaker: SHARON AND SAMIR
dialogues.text: They hurry through the park. Samir is extremely agitated, eyes constantly darting from right to left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not the way to the bath-house.  You said to get a key from my uncle  so that we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh... If you'd stop whining  you'd feel the surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SURVEILLANCE VAN
dialogues.text: Colonel Hardwick, earphones on, overhearing them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for the light to turn yellow  and then cross against the traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Col. Hardwick's computer, a GRID MAP of Brooklyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- North on Ditmas Avenue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sound garden's ready.

dialogues.speaker: A TRIANGULATED FIELD OF MICROPHONES
dialogues.text: On a nearby rooftop, an Army spotter uses a parabolic wit gunsight. Another mic is in a woman's shopping bag; anoth is in a twenty year-old's boom box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling) Sharon, please, I beg you. Do not  make me do this. If they even dream  we are being followed they will kill  us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The light turns RED, they race across a crowded street.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH AN ARAB NEIGHBORHOOD
dialogues.text: Where women in chadors carry mesh bags with tonight's mea

dialogues.speaker: INTO A CLEAN APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Nothing but a single bed with a dirty white sheet. Sharon enters and turns on the TV... loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. (takes out a pocket- knife) Raise your arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts the stitches under his armpit and begins to dig the transponder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They cannot even dream we are being  followed, isn't that what you said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon very deliberately wipes her BLOODY HANDS on the WH SHEETS. On TV, we SEE the MARCHERS in front of Brooklyn Borough h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "-- that we will not be made afraid  to walk free in this great city. I  say, march across the bridge and  into the stadium. Demand the release  of --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir is staring at the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is all so... tragic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with rising dread) ...They're going to hit the march.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arab and Jew, side by side. Black  and White, Christian and Muslim --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SURVEILLANCE VAN
dialogues.text: They appear as SPECTRAL images on Hardwick's microwave sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- so American. Can you imagine a  better target?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his handset) Get me Devereaux.

dialogues.speaker: BOROUGH HALL
dialogues.text: THE CROWD is getting fired up as the SPEAKER exhorts them SOLDIERS watch uneasily, not certain how to respond as th crowd begins to CHANT, "No Fear! No fear!" Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: THE APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Sharon goes to a closet and takes out some old clothes. S TURNS OFF THE TV. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Put this on. We don't want our  friends sweating too much while they  wait.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE VAN
dialogues.text: Hardwick speaks into a handset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're getting ready to move. Units  1 and 2, on my signal --

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY
dialogues.text: Seem to materialize out of nowhere -- boxing them in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: Undercover FEDERAL AGENTS roust Army CID agents. An FBI a with a deep drawl, spread-eagles one against a building:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, there, I'm new in town. Can you  direct me to Carnegie Hall, or should  I just go fuck myself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NYPD under the command of Danny Sussman -- roll up th rest of the sound garden -- examine the parabolic microph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow off the rear door of the surveillance van. Frank ent and looks around at all the high-tech, microwave technolo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, microwave.

dialogues.speaker: TWO WOMEN
dialogues.text: In chadors, faces VEILED, descend a back staircase. Only their faces emerge from the shadows and are caught by a d bulb do we recognize Sharon and Samir. Sharon unlocks a metal door to reveal THE HIDDEN COURTYAR of a neighboring building. She and Samir hurry through a  back alley and out into an adjacent street.

dialogues.speaker: BOROUGH HALL, (WAS SHOT AS 194)
dialogues.text: Where several APC's suddenly roar up and BLOCK off the sq Devereaux stands nearby, watching as:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (though a bullhorn) This is an unlawful gathering. You  must disperse. I repeat --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers in full RIOT GEAR emerge to form a battle line:  images of Selma, 1963; Chicago, 1968; Los Angeles, 1993.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Join together! Join hands!

dialogues.speaker: THE MARCHERS LINK ARMS
dialogues.text: Arab clerics and Hassidic rabbis, Black civic leaders and Hispanic gang members -- all continue to CHANT, "No fear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nervously look at one another as the  marchers begin to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through a bullhorn) These soldiers carry live ammunition.  This is your final warning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "No Fear... No Fear..." Devereaux watches in dread as the marchers close the gap on the battle-line of anxious sold is this why he became a soldier? A YOUNG GIRL unselfconsciously approaches a young soldier Looks into his eyes. Smiles. And walks past. Another marc walks right past a soldier, who does nothing to stop her. Soon, they are all surging past the riot-line. DEVEREAUX watches, as something is revealed to him, somet about America that, until this moment, he had forgotten.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SURVEILLANCE VAN
dialogues.text: Frank is fiddling with the new technology like a kid at  Christmas. But something is wrong. Where once there were GHOSTLY IMAGES of Samir and Sharon in the apartment -- no there is NOTHING.

dialogues.speaker: ON HUB'S OSCILLOSCOPE
dialogues.text: The RADIO-SIGNAL of Samir's transmitter still registers a an unmoving, steadily blinking light. Hub is watching the building. Frank steps out the van, his face pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a problem.

dialogues.speaker: HUB AND FRANK
dialogues.text: Pound up the stairs of the building.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR TO THE CLEAN APARTMENT
dialogues.text: Bursts open. Hub comes in low and fast. Frank comes in ha on his heels. In the center of the otherwise empty room, the white shee SMEARED IN BLOOD, is draped over a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub stares in dread fascination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shroud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he's out the door in a heartbeat. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE SURVEILLANCE VAN
dialogues.text: Frank and Hub listen to a playback of Sharon's conversati with Samir on the digital recorders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...sweating too much while they  wait."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank looks up at Hub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First she turns off the tv, then she  says it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew we were listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hits them both at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hammam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub and Frank hit the street at a dead run.

dialogues.speaker: BENEATH THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Samir opens a padlocked door with a key. He and Sharon  disappear within.

dialogues.speaker: A HAMMAM
dialogues.text: An Arab bath-house. Rays of sunlight play off the steamin waters. Their footsteps ECHO off the tiled mosaic walls. Sequence omitted from original script.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHOUSE
dialogues.text: Samir kneels to touch the steaming water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How soon are they coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts taking off his clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He finishes disrobing.

dialogues.speaker: NAKED
dialogues.text: He steps into the bath. With a sponge he washes his body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What message do you have for them,  Sharon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell them when they're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DISTANT SOUND of the approaching MARCH echoes off the tiled walls as Samir steps out of the purifying waters an takes a towel from a hamper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody else is coming, is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the hamper he takes a Sig-Sauer .9 automatic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the last cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There will never be a last cell. (racks the slide of  the .9) You should listen to the young men  in that stadium. It is just beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon watches, in dread fascination, as he takes a white egyptian-cotton FUNERAL SHROUD and drops it over his head

dialogues.speaker: THE MARCHERS
dialogues.text: Are streaming down the street. Hub and Frank desperately fight their way through a wild, almost "carnival" feel.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO
dialogues.text: Reflected in the purifying waters, Samir is putting civil clothes on over the shroud -- still holding the .9 on Sha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I have missed the play --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a forgiving gesture) It was the money. You believe money  is power. Belief is power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Just tell me we didn't finance  your operation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a sad smile) The world is a wheel. So... what  message do you have for me, Sharon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to release him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praise God. When will he be free --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few months at most. First, they  have to bring him to trial, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns away from her, opening the hamper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not looking at her) -- No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But... that's what you want, isn't  it? Why you've done all this --

dialogues.speaker: BELT OF SEMTEX EXPLOSIVES
dialogues.text: Comes next. Velcro straps fasten the belt around his ches

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes to stand beside her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to bleed... as we have  bled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir, the Koran preaches --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not speak to me of the Koran,  woman. (fighting his emotion) You take our leader. A holy man. You  put him in prison for preaching the  word of God. You must learn the  consequences of trying to tell the  world how to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with rising terror) But it's over, your point's been  made, why spill any more blood? Those  poor people out there in the street,  they're fucking marching for your  cause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (fastens the last  strap on his semtex  harness) And they, too, will become its  martyrs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A VOICE from the top of the stairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go and you'll live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir looks up, sees Hub aiming his .45. But Sharon is be them, blocking his shot. From outside, we HEAR the sound of the marchers' CHANTING "No Fear...! No Fear...!" Samir HEARS it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go and you'll live --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming, panicked) GET AWAY FROM THE DOOR --!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SAMIR --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU WANT TO DIE --!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're all SCREAMING at once. Still Samir keeps inching  toward the stairs. Hub blocks the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way you're going out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir jams the gun into Sharon's ribs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVE AWAY --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon's eyes meet Hubs'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHUT UP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samir is edging ever closer. Starting up the stairs. Shar eyes plead with Hub, begging for a kind of unholy redempt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOOT ME --!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... CAN'T --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YOU HAVE TO. (weeping now) You... promised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub's finger tightens on the trigger. But then slowly, al imperceptibly at first, he lowers his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) No --!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is God's will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His left hand moves imperceptibly toward the RIPCORD of t explosive device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If there is a God, he weeps at the  crimes we commit in his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rips through Sharon into Samir, blowing them both backwar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is to Samir's hand as it reaches for the ripcord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is a killing headshot. Rolling him into the baths.

dialogues.speaker: CLOUD OF BLOOD
dialogues.text: Blooms in the cleansing water. The funeral shroud billows

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still rings in the tiled room as Hub kneels beside Sharon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Officer down. OFFICER DOWN --!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is... he... dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Shhhhhhh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) ...no... regrets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub cradles her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the saddest smile) I... wondered.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK HADDAD
dialogues.text: Appears at the top of the steps. Behind him, two PARAMEDI race down to kneel beside Sharon. Hub is pushed aside as  they begin triage -- but it doesn't look good as suddenly she begins to convulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon... SHARON --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Emma... My name... is Emma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then she begins to mumble, at first incoherently, and then more clearly. We realize she's speaking Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- what are you? I don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Frank is standing above them. Tears in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating) "I... seek refuge... king of kings..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Hub suddenly understands: she is preparing for her ow death. He holds her as she continues to pray in and out o her two native tongues. Until, at last:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Allah Ahkbar. God is great --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allah Ahkbar --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she's gone.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE IN THE STREETS
dialogues.text: A block away, we can see the Marchers pass by. The chant "No Fear..." fades into the distance. But Hub has already turned his back and is hurrying away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub hurries toward the Courthouse.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: JUDGE FRANKEL opens the door. He is taken aback by the bl on Hub's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to talk about a free society.

dialogues.speaker: THE STADIUM COMMAND POST
dialogues.text: Where Devereaux is watching coverage of the march.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- "a very moving moment in which  the people of a city step forward to  declare their courage and solidarity --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks up to see Hub. He's carrying the ACCORDION FILE  that the Chief of Staff gave him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Hubbard, do you want to tell  me exactly what you mean detaining  Colonel Hardwick and six of my CID  staff. Because that strikes me as a  very peculiar idea of interagency  liaison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last cell has been taken down.  It was Samir. I took him out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What makes you so sure he was the  last cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon is not trustworthy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sharon is dead. She gave her life. (takes a piece of  paper from his pocket) This is a writ from the US District  Court releasing all those being held  here without habeus corpus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My authority supersedes the civilian  judiciary under the decree of martial  law. (a rueful smile) Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your authority ends now. It's all  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at him) They're going to release him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Release him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheik. (holds up the Chief  of Staff's' file) Clear violation of international  law, Congressional oversight statutes,  a couple of treaties, the Federal  perjury statute, and my favorite,  the Logan Act, for conducting your  own personal foreign policy. (simply) I know the whole story, General.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know shit. Poor suffering  Sharon and her poor suffering people.  It's called "going native" -- the  most elementary error of an  intelligence operative and she made  it. She had all of you working for  her and she was working for them  without even knowing it. And now  they're getting exactly what they  want, which is the Sheik will be  back in the mix. But ten times as  strong, because now he's the big man  who stood up to the Americans. (looks at Hub) I did what was necessary. I make no  apologies. If you think you're going  to be able to use that file against  me, you know even less about politics  than I imagined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General. I'm not in politics. You  can have this back. I won't use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub hands him the file. Devereaux takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you don't have the balls. (off Hub's look) Did you expect me to get all weepy  with gratitude? You serve your  country. (dismissively) Is there anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub would love to just... clock him. Instead:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I wasn't in politics. I'm  not. I'm in law enforcement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes his gun from its shoulder holster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: William Devereaux, you are under  arrest for the torture and murder of  Tariq Husseini under color of  authority, United States Code Title  42, Chapter 21, Subchapter 1, Sections  1983. (takes out his gun) Surrender your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind them, a COMMOTION as Frank and several agents forc their way into the room, followed by REPORTERS, who shout questions as STROBES and VIDEOTAPE record the arrest.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE STADIUM
dialogues.text: An NYPD car -- Devereaux within, pulls away, lights flash

dialogues.speaker: HUNDREDS OF YOUNG ARAB BOYS
dialogues.text: Emerge from tunnel and into the waiting arms of their mot the tearful smiles of their wives and children. Hub and F stand there, watching the reunions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a moment) Did we win or did we lose --?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hub has no answer. No one has the answer.
